DogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.
LocationString: Located in Tongariro Forest Conservation Area
Name: 42 Traverse
Introduction: The 42 Traverse is a 46 km multi-use track through the Tongariro Forest Conservation Area.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: 42 Traverse. Photo: Tongariro River Rafting.

Alerts.Heading: 42 Traverse closed to 4WD from 15 March 2016
Alerts.Detail:
The 42 Traverse will be closed to all 4WD vehicles from 15 March 2016. It will not re-open to 4WD vehicles till 1 December 2016.

The closure is due to safety concerns around severe gouging of the track from heavy rain events, and overgrown vegetation that has reduced visibility.

Light utility vehicles (LUV) and all terrain vehicles (ATV) will be able to access the track from the end of Kapoors Road to Canyon Lookout but are asked not continue beyond this point until repairs are carried out. Walkers and mountain bikers can continue to use the 42 Traverse but are advised to take care and be extra cautious on the track.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
LocationString: Located in Ruahine Forest Park
Name: A Frame Hut & Takapari Road Track
Introduction: Head to Tamaki Road end by following the track up through forest to Takapari Road.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Ruahine tops.

LocationString: Located in A'Deanes Bush & Monckton Scenic Reserves
Name: ADeanes Bush Walk
Introduction: Take a walk through beautiful native forest dominated by matai and kahikatea as well as a large totara tree.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: A large totara tree.

LocationString: Located in Abel Tasman National Park
Name: Abel Tasman Coast Track
Introduction:
Blessed with a mild climate, golden beaches and lush
coastal native bush, the Abel Tasman Coast Track has it
all.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Te Pukatea Bay.

Alerts.Heading: Track maintenance
Alerts.Detail:
There will be ongoing maintenance between Anchorage Bay and Bark Bay/Wairima from 16 May 2016 to 31 August 2016. There will be some blasting along the track which may result in delays for visitors.

DOC workers will be clearly visible and for your own safety, obey any instructions issued by them.

Alerts.Heading: Abel Tasman Coast Track: Awaroa Estuary  high tide delays
Alerts.Detail:
When accessing Awaroa Hut from the South note that at high tide the beach in front of the Awaroa houses is flooded by the high tide. 

Visitors should wait for the tide to recede as there is no formed track through the esplanade reserve in front of the houses. Do not walk through private properties. The road access to Awaroa car park is rough and not recommended for two wheel drive vehicles during inclement weather.

This is a long term alert.

Alerts.Heading: Whariwharangi Hut - hazardous chimney
Alerts.Detail:
The fireplace in Whariwharangi Hut has been closed as the flue is corroded and is causing further damage to the historic brick chimney.

The historic brick chimney on the west side of the hut is crumbling. Until the chimney can be checked throroughly the area is cordoned off keep clear of this area for your safety.

Whariwharangi Hut remains open.

This is a long term alert until at least October 2016

LocationString: Located in Molesworth Station - Acheron Road closed
Name: Acheron Road
Introduction: Acheron Road is closed for the season.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Acheron Road.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

Alerts.Heading: Northbank road closures

Bartletts Creek Road is closed to all traffic, walkers and mountain bikers - logging and roading operations are taking place in the area. No access to the Wakamarina Track from this road.

Kiwi Road via Onamalutu, and Goulter Road are fully open.

Reviewed on 27 January 2016

LocationString: Located in Kaimai Mamaku Forest Park
Name: Ananui Falls Track

LocationString: Located in Kahurangi National Park

Introduction: Explore beautiful beech forest, dramatic gorge scenery and rock debris dam at Lake Stanley.

LocationString: Located in Anaura Bay area
Name: Anaura Bay Walkway

LocationString: Located in Nelson Lakes National Park

Alerts.Heading: Bridge removal on Travers-Cascade Track/Route
Alerts.Detail:
The Hukere Stream Bridge on the Travers-Cascade Track/Route has been removed as it is vulnerable to avalanche damage during winter. The bridge will be replaced next summer.

The stream may be difficult to cross after periods of heavy rain and visitors should be aware that the route is prone to icy/slippery conditions. 

Reviewed on 31 May 2016

Alerts.Heading: Nelson Lakes - thefts from vehicles
Alerts.Detail: There have been an increase in the number of vehicle break-ins at track carparks this season. Don't leave any valuables in your vehicle. A bag storage facility is available at the Rotoiti/Nelson Lakes Visitor Centre.

LocationString: Located in Queen Charlotte Sound/Ttaranui area

Alerts.Heading: Casey Hut burnt down
Alerts.Detail:
Casey Hut burnt down on 3 October 2015. If you visit this area we recommended you carry a tent. The 8-bunk Trust/Poulter Hut is a further 1 hour 30 minutes up the Poulter valley and requires river crossings.

This is a long term alert.

Alerts.Heading: Winter conditions on Avalanche Peak
Alerts.Detail:
Currently there is no snow on Avalanche Peak but trampers should be aware that these conditions will change with the next snowfall. While it is possible to complete the loop track via Avalanche Peak and Scotts tracks/routes, we recommended using only Scotts track/route as there is less likelihood of ice in shaded areas.

Reviewed on 7 July 2016

Alerts.Heading: Heavy snow and ice in all alpine terrains
Alerts.Detail: Very heavy snow and ice on all tracks / routes above the bushline. Do not attempt to access these areas without alpine / avalanche awareness and skills. Iceaxe and crampons are essential.

LocationString: Located in Arthur's Pass National Park

Alerts.Heading: Winter conditions on Avalanche Peak
Alerts.Detail:
Currently there is no snow on Avalanche Peak but trampers should be aware that these conditions will change with the next snowfall. While it is possible to complete the loop track via Avalanche Peak and Scotts tracks/routes, we recommended using only Scotts track/route as there is less likelihood of ice in shaded areas.

Reviewed on 7 July 2016

Alerts.Heading: Heavy snow and ice in all alpine terrains
Alerts.Detail: Very heavy snow and ice on all tracks / routes above the bushline. Do not attempt to access these areas without alpine / avalanche awareness and skills. Iceaxe and crampons are essential.

Windblown trees have been reported on the Deep Creek wet weather section of this track. Take care and allow more time for your trip.

Reviewed on 13 October 2015

Alerts.Heading: Rabbit control operations
Alerts.Detail:
Rabbit control operations using Pinedon poison will take place from 15 July 2016 in the following areas: 

  • Albert Town Conservation Area
  • Hawea River Marginal Strip
  • Butterfields Wildlife Management Area
  • Clutha River Conservation Area/Marginal strip
  • Scenic Reserve/Covenant Area
  • The Nook Scenic Reserve
  • Contact Scenic Reserve
  • Lower Lindis Conservation Area
  • Mata-Au Scientific Reserve.

Warning signs will be removed when the areas are declared non toxic (13 months after the bait has been laid).

If you see a warning sign about the pesticide Pindone:

  • do not touch pellets
  • watch Children at all times
  • do not eat animals from this area or from within a 2 km "buffer zone" outside the operational boundary.

Only when the warning signs have been removed is the all clear given and normal activities in the area can occur.

For further information contact Patrik Eschenmoser: peschenmoser@doc.govt.nz.

Alerts.Heading: Cape Foulwind Track Upgrade
Alerts.Detail:
Upgrade to the track between Omau and the Seal Colony viewing platform is being carried out in stages from Monday 6 June and Friday 5 August 2016.

The walkway will be closed to visitors between the directional sign north of the seal colony platform to the first style at the top of the hill from Monday 11 July to Monday 25 July 2016.

During the week of 11 July to 15 July 2016 there will be helicopter flying in the area.

Visitors are asked to adhere to all signage and instructions from contractors on site.

Reviewed on 8 July 2016

Alerts.Heading: Copland Track may be closed during severe weather
Alerts.Detail:
During severe weather, such as sustained or heavy rainfall, the Copland Track may be closed (often at short notice) due to flooding or other damage. If closed, notices will be placed at the start of the track.

Check the weather and conditions at the nearest DOC office before you depart. Refunds will be issued in these cases - contact the Westland Tai Poutini National Park Visitor Centre and i-SITE for details.

This alert is valid long term.

IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Trampers at East Ahuriri Hut in Ahuriri River East Branch valley.

WalkingTime: 2 hr one way to river forks
LocationString: Located in Fiordland National Park, Milford Road/Milford Sound area
Name: East Eglinton Track
Introduction: This challenging tramping route leads from the Milford Road, up the East Eglinton river valley through beech forest.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Beginning of East Eglinton Branch Track.

LocationString: Located in East Egmont area, Egmont National Park
Name: East Egmont barrier-free walks
Introduction: Although these walks are maintained to wheel chair standard, theyre great for families with a baby on board as well.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: The wheelchair accessible Lookout Track. Photo: J. Spence.

LocationString: Located in East Egmont area, Egmont National Park
Name: East Egmont tramping tracks
Introduction: Well-benched tracks lead through montane forest, providing a great introduction to the mountain environment.

Alerts.Heading: Snow and icy conditions in Egmont National Park
Alerts.Detail:
Winter has arrived in Egmont National Park and there are additional safety hazards to consider.

It's a good idea to check the mountain conditions and contact Egmont National Park Visitor Centre before heading up the mountain.

If you are planning a visit make sure you are prepared for the cold, wet winter conditions.

LocationString: Located in East Egmont area, Egmont National Park
Name: East Egmont walking tracks
Introduction: A great introduction to the mountain environment with superb views of the surrounding countryside.

LocationString: Located in Matukituki Valley area, Mount Aspiring National Park
Name: East Matukituki Valley tracks
Introduction: The East Matukituki Valley provides interesting day walks and access to several demanding tramping and climbing routes in Mount Aspiring National Park.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: JThe head of the Kitchener Valley. Photo: M Symons.

LocationString: Located in Molesworth Station
Name: East West Route, Molesworth Station
Introduction: The East West Route links the Kahutara River in Clarence (Ka Whata Tu o Rakihouia) Conservation Park with the Sedgemere Lakes area in the Molesworth Recreation Reserve.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Rob Avery at Lake McRae. Photo: Jim Herdman.

LocationString: Located in Arthur's Pass National Park
Name: Edwards - Hawdon Route
Introduction: This route takes you through spectacular rock-fall, past mountain tarns and over two alpine passes.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: At Tarn Col. Image: Harley James

Alerts.Heading: Heavy snow and ice in all alpine terrains
Alerts.Detail: Very heavy snow and ice on all tracks / routes above the bushline. Do not attempt to access these areas without alpine / avalanche awareness and skills. Iceaxe and crampons are essential.

Alerts.Heading: Mingha carpark has moved 500 m south
Alerts.Detail:
The Mingha carpark and the old access track across the railway line to the Mingha and Edwards Valley has been closed off due to SH73 realignment work. A new temporary carpark has been developed at the shingle pit area near the Bealey Rail Bridge, approximately 500 m south of the old carpark.

From the new carpark there is a marked walking track across the railway line immediately adjacent to the rail bridge on to the causeway, then up the causeway to connect with the old track. Note there are construction crews working in the same area as the new carpark.

Long-term alert - no change anticipated until September 2016

LocationString: Located in Arthur's Pass National Park
Name: Edwards - Otehake Route
Introduction: A  transalpine route that mixes the best of east with the wilds of the west.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Looking up the Edwards valley.

Alerts.Heading: Heavy snow and ice in all alpine terrains
Alerts.Detail: Very heavy snow and ice on all tracks / routes above the bushline. Do not attempt to access these areas without alpine / avalanche awareness and skills. Iceaxe and crampons are essential.

Alerts.Heading: Mingha carpark has moved 500 m south
Alerts.Detail:
The Mingha carpark and the old access track across the railway line to the Mingha and Edwards Valley has been closed off due to SH73 realignment work. A new temporary carpark has been developed at the shingle pit area near the Bealey Rail Bridge, approximately 500 m south of the old carpark.

From the new carpark there is a marked walking track across the railway line immediately adjacent to the rail bridge on to the causeway, then up the causeway to connect with the old track. Note there are construction crews working in the same area as the new carpark.

Long-term alert - no change anticipated until September 2016

Alerts.Heading: Track damage on Otira flood track
Alerts.Detail:
There are fallen trees and slips on Morrison Bridge to Pfeifer Creek Track (Otira flood track).

Reviewed on 28 June 2016

LocationString: Located in Fiordland National Park, Lake Monowai/Borland Road area
Name: Eldrig Peak Route
Introduction: This quite steep and difficult tramping track leads from the Borland Road through beech forest then into the tops where you can enjoy gorgeous views of Fiordland.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: View from Mt Eldrig.

Alerts.Heading: Tree falls on Lake Monowai/Borland Tracks
Alerts.Detail:
Some tree falls are possible on all tracks in the Lake Monowai/Borland Road area.

Reviewed on 18 December 2015

LocationString: Located in Kaimai Mamaku Forest Park
Name: Eliza Mine Loop Track
Introduction: Evidence of the past can be savoured today as trampers walk through the Eliza Mine Loop Track.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Forest cover at Eliza mine.

LocationString: Located in Kahurangi National Park, Mount Arthur area
Name: Ellis Basin Route
Introduction: Enjoy extensive views of the Ellis Basin and the surrounding mountains on this track to Ellis Hut.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Ellis Basin.

LocationString: Located in Everett Park Scenic Reserve
Name: Everett Park Scenic Reserve walk
Introduction: Large grassed areas on the banks of the Manganui River, makes this a popular picnic and swimming area.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Picnic spot on the bank of the Manganui River.

LocationString: Located in Oteake Conservation Park
Name: Ewe Range Track
Introduction: The Ewe Range Track provides walking access to the northern end of Oteake Conservation Park.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Views towards Diadem and Ohau Ranges from Ewe Range Track.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
LocationString: Located in Eyre Mountains/Taka R Haka Conservation Park
Name: Eyre Mountains/Taka Ra Haka routes
Introduction: A spectacular conservation park in the Eyre Mountains/Taka Ra Haka for the more adventurous tramper, hunter or trout fisher.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Eyre Mountains.

Alerts.Heading: Acton Burn area closed
Alerts.Detail:
Access into the Eyre Mountains via Acton Road is closed until further notice. Rayonier NZ is working heavy machinery in the area and have closed access for public health and safety.

This is a long term alert.

Parks: Eyre Mountains/Taka R Haka Conservation Park

WalkingTime: 4 hr to bush edge, 6 - 8 hr to rock bivvy
LocationString: Located in Fiordland National Park, Milford Road/Milford Sound area
Name: Falls Creek Route
Introduction: A challenging tramping route from the Milford Road into the Falls Creek valley, surrounded by impressive Fiordland mountains.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Start of Falls Creek Track, Milford Road.

LocationString: Located in Northern Coromandel
Name: Fantail Bay Track
Introduction: A tramping track leaves from the Fantail Bay campsite and leads to the bushline where youll find outstanding views.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Camping at Fantail Bay. Photo: C Rudge.

LocationString: Located in Farewell Spit and Puponga Farm Park
Name: Farewell Spit and Puponga Farm Park tracks
Introduction: Choose from shorter or longer walks across farmland, and discover a lighthouse and spectacular views of the rugged coastline.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Wharariki Beach.
Parks: Farewell Spit and Puponga Farm Park

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
LocationString: Located in Pelorus and Kenepuru Sounds area
Name: Ferndale tracks
Introduction: From the Ferndale campsite there is a 15 minute loop track.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Kenepuru Sound.

DogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.
LocationString: Located in Otaki Forks area, Tararua Forest Park
Name: Field Hut and Table Top
Introduction: The day trip to Table Top is the classic climb to the tops of the western Tararua Range.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Field Hut. Photo: Wayne Boness.

Alerts.Heading: Otaki Gorge Road closed
Alerts.Detail:
Otaki Gorge Road is closed due a slip. Do not attempt to walk across the slip. The slip is unstable with potential rock falls.

The best access to Otaki Forks is via the Otaki Forks emergency access track, starting from Shields Flat Historic Reserve carpark.

Alternative campsites are Catchpool Valley and Holdsworth.

Work to restore road access will start towards the end of March 2016. It is expected to be completed and the road reopened some time after July 2016. More on the Kapiti Coast District Council website.

This alert is valid long term. Reviewed 6 July 2016.

LocationString: Located in Karikari Peninsula
Name: Fig Tree Track
Introduction: This loop track takes you to the highest point in Maitai Bay giving you scenic views across Karikari Peninsula and Puwheke.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Looking down on Maitai Bay. Photo: itravelNZ | CC BY 2.0.

Alerts.Heading: Fig Tree Track closed
Alerts.Detail:
Fig Tree Track is closed due to hazards that could affect public safety.

Reviewed on 28 June 2016

DogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.
LocationString: Located in Taupo area
Name: Five Mile Bay and Awaroa Tracks
Introduction: These family friendly tracks stretch along the expanse of Five Mile Bay, and are great for either walking or biking.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Looking out towards Mount Ruapehu through the wetland at Five Mile Bay: PHOTO: sharpjacqui | Creative Commons.

LocationString: Located in Catchpool Valley & Orongorongo Valley, Rimutaka Forest Park
Name: Five Mile Loop Track
Introduction: This easy track passes through superb groves of mature hard beech in the lower reaches of Graces Stream.

LocationString: Located in Russell area
Name: Flagstaff Hill Track
Introduction: Enjoy 360 degree views of the Bay of Islands from this important historic site - the Union Jack was first flown here in 1840, then chopped down four times up till 1845 as a symbolic gesture against British rule.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Institute of Surveyors Centennial sundial and mosaic.

LocationString: Located in Kahurangi National Park, Mount Arthur area
Name: Flora Hut and Mount Arthur Hut tracks
Introduction: Walk through beech forest to one of two huts, or combine the tracks for a circuit walk.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Mount Arthur Track

LocationString: Located in Kahurangi National Park, Mount Arthur area
Name: Flora Saddle to Barron Flat Track
Introduction: This backcountry ride traverses through a variety of landscapes and terrains following a historic pack track.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Ditte van der Meulen riding the Flora Track. Photo: Dave Mitchell.

LocationString: Located in Nelson Lakes National Park

Introduction: From Lake Rotoroa car park, this track passes through a stand of kahikatea and around the lake outlet emerging on the road near Lake Rotoroa Lodge.

LocationString: Located in Great Barrier Island Aotea
Name: Forest Road (Port Fitzroy - Whangaparapara)

DogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.
LocationString: Located in Fort Takapuna Historic Reserve
Name: Fort Takapuna Historic Walk
Introduction: Take in military history and superb views of the Hauraki Gulf in a wander around the Fort Takapuna Historic Reserve.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only.
LocationString: Located in Waipoua Forest
Name: Four Sisters Walk

LocationString: Located in Lake Tekapo area
Name: Four wheel drive tracks - Tekapo
Introduction: Above Lake Tekapo are two four wheel drive journeys following river valleys.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Four-wheel driving in Macaulay River valley.

DogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.
LocationString: Located in St James Conservation Area
Name: Fowlers Pass Track
Introduction: Fowlers Pass (1296 m) connects Fowlers Hut on Tophouse Road with Stanley Vale and Lake Guyon huts in the St James Conservation Area.

LocationString: Located in Fox Glacier area, Westland Tai Poutini National Park

IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Fox Glacier.

LocationString: Located in Franz Josef Glacier/K Roimata o Hine Hukatere, Westland Tai Poutini National Park

LocationString: Located in Fiordland National Park, Lake Manapouri area

LocationString: Located in French Pass and D'Urville Island Scenic Reserves

LocationString: Located in Matukituki Valley area, Mount Aspiring National Park

Alerts.Heading: Snow present above bushline
Alerts.Detail:
Snow present above bushline. Alpine skills essential and extreme care required.

DogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.
LocationString: Located in Holdsworth area, Tararua Forest Park

LocationString: Located in Fiordland National Park, Southern fiords area

LocationString: Located in Fiordland National Park, Milford Road/Milford Sound area

Snow present above bushline. Alpine skills essential and extreme care required.

LocationString: Located in Gillespies Beach

Alerts.Detail: There has been serious flood damage to the Gillespies Lagoon Boardwalks. As a result of this damage the Miners Tunnel Track and Galway Beach Track are closed until the boardwalks can be repaired. At this stage the length of closure is not known.

Some tree falls are possible on all tracks in the Lake Monowai/Borland Road area.

LocationString: Located in Greenstone and Caples Conservation Areas

There are several slips between the Caples/Greenstone confluence and Mid Caples Hut navigate with care during periods of poor weather.

This is a long term alert.

LocationString: Located in Mount Grey/Maukatere Conservation Area

IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Gunns Bush Track.

LocationString: Located in Whirinaki Te Pua-a-Tne Conservation Park

LocationString: Located in Mount Aspiring National Park
Name: Haast Pass/Tioripatea Highway

LocationString: Located in Mount Aspiring National Park
Name: Haast Pass/Tioripatea Highway short walks

LocationString: Located in Hakarimata Scenic Reserve

Introduction: This family walking and cycling track follows the route of the former Ngaruawahia/Glen Massey railway to attractive stream cascades.

LocationString: Located in Hakarimata Scenic Reserve

LocationString: Located in Hakarimata Scenic Reserve

LocationString: Located in Hamurana Springs Recreation Reserve

LocationString: Located in Doubtful Sound/Patea area, Fiordland National Park

LocationString: Located in Hanmer Forest Park

LocationString: Located in Hanmer Forest Park

Alerts.Heading: Section of Jolliffes Track closed

Alerts.Heading: Spur Track closed indefinitely
Alerts.Detail:
Spur Track is closed indefinitely, until the lower half of the track is reinstated after commercial logging operations.

Reviewed on 28 June 2016

WalkingTime: Range from 1 hr 30 min - 2 hr 30 min return
LocationString: Located in Hanmer Forest Park
Name: Hanmer Forest Park walking tracks
Introduction: Walking tracks in Hanmer Forest range in length from 1.

LocationString: Located in Hapuakohe Range

LocationString: Located in Great Barrier Island Aotea

LocationString: Located in Harihari area

Introduction: Harihari Coastal Walkway is one of the most scenic walkways on the West Coast, with spectacular views of forest, rivers, mountains and coastline.

LocationString: Located in Arthur's Pass National Park, Kelly Range - Styx River area

Alerts.Heading: Heavy snow and ice in all alpine terrains
Alerts.Detail: Very heavy snow and ice on all tracks / routes above the bushline. Do not attempt to access these areas without alpine / avalanche awareness and skills. Iceaxe and crampons are essential.

Alerts.Heading: Slip on track to Scotty's Cableway
Alerts.Detail:
A slip has wiped out the steep section of track over the bluff to Scottys Cableway on the true left. This extremely steep section is suitable for highly experienced users only.

Reviewed on 26 November 2015

Alerts.Heading: Slip on track above Taipo River
Alerts.Detail:
Below Seven Mile Creek the Taipo River has cut into the bank and there is a new bench track above the river. Users should take note of track markers. Note: This section is suitable for foot access only no 4WD access. View a map of the Taipo flood route (PDF, 220K).

Reviewed on 26 April 2016

LocationString: Located in Arthur's Pass National Park, Lake Sumner Forest Park

Alerts.Heading: Track damage on Otira flood track
Alerts.Detail:
There are fallen trees and slips on Morrison Bridge to Pfeifer Creek Track (Otira flood track).

Reviewed on 28 June 2016

LocationString: Located in Abel Tasman National Park, Canaan Downs Scenic Reserve

LocationString: Located in Whakarewarewa State Forest Park

IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Hatupatu Trail.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only.
LocationString: Located in Waima & Mataraua Forests
Name: Hauturu Highpoint Track
Introduction: Climb onto a razor back ridge in the Waima Ranges for sensational views and pristine vegetation.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Tree. Photo: Juliette Pallies.

LocationString: Located in Dunedin area, Karitane/Waikouaiti area
Name: Hawksbury lagoon and beach walk
Introduction: Walk around Hawksbury lagoon in Waikouaiti and enjoy this wildlife refuge providing habitat for ducks and native birds which can be seen from the causeways that cross the pools.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Hawksbury Lagoon. Image: Brian C Monk

LocationString: Located in Kahurangi National Park
Name: Heaphy Track
Introduction: Travel through expansive tussock downs, lush forests and nkau palms to the roaring seas of the West Coast.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Swingbridge over Wekakura Creek.

LocationString: Located in Doubtful Sound/Patea area, Fiordland National Park
Name: Helena Falls Track
Introduction: This tramping track in Deep Cove, Doubtful Sound leads around the cove to a stream looking up to Helena Falls.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Helena Falls is in beautiful Doubtful Sound. Photo: Nicky Jackson.

LocationString: Located in Kaimai Mamaku Forest Park
Name: Henderson Tramline Loop Track
Introduction: This walk follows a branch of the tramline through the bush to the North South track, and returns along a separate tramline branch back to the road.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Impressive forest scenery along Henderson Tramline.

LocationString: Located in Henga Scenic Reserve
Name: Henga Scenic Reserve Walk
Introduction: The reserve features spectacular regeneration by kopi (karaka) and mahoe.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Henga Reserve Walk.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only.
LocationString: Located in Herekino Forest
Name: Herekino Forest Track
Introduction: The 15 km Herekino Forest Track passes through forest that is home to many rare and threatened species including the North Island brown kiwi, long-tailed bat and kauri snail.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: On the Herekino Forest Track. Photo: Angelika Cawte.

Alerts.Heading: Herekino Forest Track closed
Alerts.Detail:
The local marae trustees of Manukau and Herekino have temporarily closed the Herekino Forest Track in response to Kauri dieback disease being present in Herekino Forest.

The Kaitaia DOC office acknowledges the stance taken by the local Iwi and appreciate that this may cause an inconvenience to trampers. We ask that people acknowledge the wishes of the local marae trustees until a response to Kauri dieback disease has been developed at this site.

Kauri dieback disease is killing our native kauri. It spreads by soil movement, but you can help prevent it.

LocationString: Located in Aramoana area, Dunedin area
Name: Heyward Point Track
Introduction: This cliff top track, through farm land and regenerating forest, offers great coastal views.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: View from start of Heyward Point Track.

LocationString: Located in Ahuriri Conservation Park
Name: Hideaway Hut Route
Introduction: This little gem of a hut is tucked away in Ahuriri Conservation Park.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Tarn on Hideaway Hut Route in Ahuriri Conservation Park. Photo: Kiersten McKinley.

LocationString: Located in Pirongia Forest Park
Name: Hihikiwi Lookout
Introduction: Walk to this lookout point on Mount Pirongia for one of the best vantage points over the west coast harbours.

LocationString: Located in Lake Rotoiti and Lake Rotoma Scenic Reserves
Name: Hinehopu/Hongi's Track
Introduction: This track highlights the area's incredible native forest and cultural importance.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Tranquil picnic spot, Paehinahina Point.
Parks: Lake Rotoiti and Lake Rotoma Scenic Reserves

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
LocationString: Located in Haast, Paringa and Moeraki Rivers area
Name: Historic Haast to Paringa Cattle Track
Introduction: This track was built in 1875 by farmers at Haast.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Moeraki River, seen from the Haast Paringa Track. PHOTO: Ian Harrison .
Parks: Haast, Paringa and Moeraki Rivers area

LocationString: Located in Hokitika Gorge Scenic Reserve
Name: Hokitika Gorge Walk
Introduction: Enjoy excellent views of the blue-green waters of the Hokitika River as it makes its way through the rock sided Hokitika Gorge.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Hokitika Gorge.

DogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.
LocationString: Located in Holdsworth area, Tararua Forest Park
Name: Holdsworth - Kaitoke Track
Introduction: Follows the Waiohine and Tauherenikau Rivers for 36 km between Holdsworth and Kaitoke.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Aerial view of Totara Flats, part of the Holdsworth - Kaitoke Tramp. Photo: Joe Hansen.

Alerts.Heading: Slips from Tutuwai Hut to Kaitoke Roadend
Alerts.Detail:
Slips and washouts along this section of the track have caused the terrain in some areas to become steep, narrow and slippery and can be difficult to negotiate. Caution is required when crossing.

Reviewed on 12 May 2016.

DogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.
WalkingTime: Powell Hut: 5  6 hr, Mount Holdsworth: 7  8 hr
LocationString: Located in Holdsworth area, Tararua Forest Park
Name: Holdsworth roadend to Powell Hut/Mount Holdsworth
Introduction: This tramp follows the Mount Holdsworth Track to Powell Hut.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Powell Hut. Photo: Joe Hansen.

LocationString: Located in Fiordland National Park, Hollyford Valley area
Name: Hollyford Track
Introduction: The Hollyford Track is a fantastic 4-8 day Fiordland tramp from the mountains to the sea at Martins Bay, and can be walked all year round.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Scenic Hollyford River/ Whakatipu K Tuka. Photo copyright: Michael Dawes. DOC USE ONLY.

Alerts.Heading: Bridge damaged / closed - Rainbow Creek
Alerts.Detail:
The swingbridge over Rainbow Creek between Hidden Falls and Alabaster Hut is damaged and consequently closed. A temporary track diversion is in place. Rainbow Creek can generally be crossed in low flows but becomes impassable during or after heavy rain.

Reviewed on 16 June 2016

LocationString: Located in Fiordland National Park, Hollyford Valley area
Name: Hollyford Track: Guided walk
Introduction: Follow the Hollyford River from the mountains to the sea, and enjoy first-rate cuisine, knowledgeable guides, personal service and comfortable private lodges in this 3 day guided walk.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Guided walk on the Hollyford Track. Photo: Hollyford Track.

LocationString: Located in Fiordland National Park, Hollyford Valley area
Name: Hollyford Track: Hidden Falls Track
Introduction: Enjoy this easy day walk along the Hollyford Track to the beautiful Hidden Falls or the nearby hut for lunch.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Tranquil forest scenes, day walking on the Hollyford Track. Photo:  Douglas Thorne.

LocationString: Located in Honeycomb Rock area
Name: Honeycomb Rock Walkway
Introduction: Honeycomb Rock is a spectacular outcrop on the Wairarapa coast, so named because of the cell-like weathering pattern which gives the rock a honeycomb appearance.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Honeycomb Rock.

LocationString: Located in Kerikeri area
Name: Hongi Hika Walk
Introduction: Walk through gum trees and regenerating native forest to Kororipo Pa.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: View of Kerikeri basin from Kororipo Pa.

LocationString: Located in Hunters Hills area
Name: Hook Bush Route
Introduction: Enjoy expansive views out across the Canterbury Plain along an marked route up into The Hunters Hills.

LocationString: Located in Lake Sumner Forest Park
Name: Hope valley (Windy Point) tracks & routes
Introduction: Hope valley in Lake Sumner Forest Park is accessed at Windy Point, beside SH 7, about 160 km from Christchurch.

LocationString: Located in Ruataniwha Conservation Park
Name: Hopkins valley tracks
Introduction: Hopkins valley, in Ruataniwha Conservation Park, is near Lake Ohau.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Hopkins valley. Photo: DOC

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only.
LocationString: Located in Tangihua Forest
Name: Horokaka Track
Introduction: Horokaka Track is a challenging track that includes strenuous climbing.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Dense vegetation in Tangihua Forest.

LocationString: Located in Coromandel Forest Park, Kauaeranga Valley
Name: Hotoritori mountain bike trails
Introduction: Riders of all ages can explore this network of trails through native and pine forest.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Mountain biker on the Hotoritori mountain bike trails.

DogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.
LocationString: Located in Taupo area
Name: Huka Falls tracks
Introduction: Take a scenic walk along the banks of the Waikato River, or simply explore the many lookout points at Huka Falls, one of the most visited natural attractions in New Zealand.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Nearly a million people every year visit the lookout points to view the spectacular Huka Falls. Photo: DOC

LocationString: Located in Fiordland National Park, Hollyford Valley area
Name: Humboldt Falls Track
Introduction: This easy, well graded walking track from the Hollyford Road takes you on a short climb through rainforest to the lookout of the impressive Humboldt Falls.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Humboldt Falls, Hollyford Valley. Photo: Mihoko Wada.

LocationString: Located in Fiordland National Park, Tuatapere area
Name: Hump Ridge Track
Introduction: A 3-day loop with marvellous views from sub-alpine tops and rugged coastline in southern Fiordland.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Trampers on the ridge.

LocationString: Located in Fiordland National Park, Tuatapere area
Name: Hump Ridge Track: Guided walk
Introduction: This 3 day guided loop for more experienced walkers, takes you along the south coast of New Zealand up to the subalpine Hump Ridge zone, over historic viaducts in the heart of the native forest.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Loop track at the top of Hump Ridge.

LocationString: Located in Dunedin area, Karitane/Waikouaiti area
Name: Huriawa P walk
Introduction: Walk around Huriawa Peninsula in Karitane and visit a p site.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Huriawa Peninsula

LocationString: Located in Lake Sumner Forest Park
Name: Hurunui swingbridge tracks & routes
Introduction: Several tracks start from Hurunui swingbridge at the end of Lake Sumner Road, which is a 4WD track from Loch Katrine onwards.

LocationString: Located in Fiordland National Park, Milford Road/Milford Sound area
Name: Hut Creek Track
Introduction: This difficult tramping track leads from the Milford Road and up the Hut Creek Valley through beech forest to the river flats.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Hut Creek tramping track.

LocationString: Located in Ruataniwha Conservation Park
Name: Huxley valley tracks
Introduction: The Huxley valley branches off Hopkins valley in Ruataniwha Conservation Park.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Trampers coming out from Huxley valley. Photo: DOC

LocationString: Located in Abel Tasman National Park
Name: Inland Track
Introduction: Inland Track travels through regenerating and undisturbed forest where tui, bellbirds and other wildlife can be seen.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: South-eastern view from Porters Rock to Motueka and Tasman Bay. Photo: Markus Baumann.

LocationString: Located in Glenorchy area
Name: Invincible Gold Mine Track
Introduction: Built by miners in the 1880s, the Invincible Gold Mine Track is an uphill walk that offers wonderful views of the Rees Valley and Mt Earnslaw/Pikirakatahi.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Invincible Gold Mine, near Glenorchy.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
LocationString: Located in Ruahine Forest Park
Name: Iron Gate Hut Track
Introduction: Iron Gate Hut is a good days hike along a sidle track up the Oroua River valley.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Iron Hut track. Photo: Karl Rollinson and Corey Watkins.

LocationString: Located in Lake Tarawera Scenic Reserve
Name: Isthmus Track
Introduction: This track is dominated by the majestic Mount Tarawera.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Geothermal activity, Lake Rotomahana.

LocationString: Located in J.M. Barker (Hapupu) National Historic Reserve
Name: J.M. Barker (Hapupu) National Historic Reserve Walk
Introduction: One of only two national historic reserves in New Zealand, Hapupu protects Moriori rakau momori (tree carvings).
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Hapupu National Reserve, Chatham Island.

Alerts.Heading: Temporary closure/rhui over rkau momori (living tree carvings)
Alerts.Detail:
Due to a rapid decline in the health of the rkau momori and subsequent breakdown of the kpi forest canopy, DOC is temporarily restricting access/placing a rhui at this reserve.

This is to protect public health and safety. The long-term objective is to protect the kpi groves and remaining rkau momori and enhance these special places for future generations to enjoy and care for.

LocationString: Located in Catlins coastal area
Name: Jacks Blowhole Track
Introduction: Walk to a spectacular blowhole with exploding waves and roaring sound effects.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Jacks Blowhole.

LocationString: Located in Queenstown area
Name: Jack's Point Track
Introduction: A walk with superb lake and mountain views over undulating open grassland and scattered scrub, ending at Jack's Point.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Jack's Point Track. Photo: Eiji Kitai.

LocationString: Located in Jackson Bay - Gorge River area
Name: Jackson Bay Okahu walks
Introduction: Follow an old pioneer's track before continuing down the river to the coast, or walk to a rocky shore and explore tidal pools.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Jackson Bay. Photo: Bruce Postill.

Alerts.Heading: Smoothwater Track closed
Alerts.Detail:
Smoothwater Track is currently closed after several slips have taken out large chunks of the track. It is dangerous for trampers to go around the slips due to the steepness of the terrain.

Reviewed on 12 May 2016.

LocationString: Located in Lake Sumner Forest Park
Name: Jollie Brook Circuit
Introduction: The Jollie Brook Circuit starts and finishes off Lake Sumner Road, in Lake Sumner Forest Park.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
WalkingTime: 3 days (Kahutara car park to Goose Flat)
LocationString: Located in Ka Whata Tu o Rakihouia Clarence
Name: Ka Whata Tu o Rakihouia/Clarence walks

Parks: Ka Whata Tu o Rakihouia Clarence

LocationString: Located in Kaharoa Conservation Area
Name: Kaharoa Kkako Track
Introduction: Kkako Track also known as the Hollow Track meanders its way down through some beautiful forest to Onaia Stream.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Kaharoa Kkako Track.

LocationString: Located in Carter Scenic Reserve
Name: Kahikatea Walk
Introduction: This 30 minute loop walks takes you through a flooded forest remnant in the Wairarapa.

LocationString: Located in Pohangina Valley area
Name: Kahikatea Walk

IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Kahikatea fruit.

LocationString: Located in Kahurangi National Park
Name: Kahurangi Point Route

Distance: 2 km one way | 8.2 km one way
WalkingTime: 30 min one way | 2 hr one way
LocationString: Located in Dargaville area
Name: Kai Iwi Lakes Coastal Track
Introduction: Walk across farmland to the expansive Ripiro Beach.

LocationString: Located in Great Barrier Island/Aotea
Name: Kaiaraara Track to Mt Hobson (Hirakimata)

LocationString: Located in Kaihoka Lakes Scenic Reserve

LocationString: Located in Kaikoura area
Name: Kaikoura Peninsula Walkway
Introduction: Observe seals and seabirds, explore historic p and whaling sites and enjoy clifftop views of the sea and mountains.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: View from Kaikoura Peninsula Walkway.

Distance: Paeroa - Waihi: 20 km, Paeroa - Te Aroha: 20 km
LocationString: Located in Kaimai Mamaku Forest Park

LocationString: Located in Kaimai Mamaku Forest Park
Name: Kaimai Summit Loop Track

LocationString: Located in Kaimanawa Forest Park

Introduction: Two family friendly short walks starting from Urchin Campsite at the end of Kaimanawa Road.

LocationString: Located in Coromandel Town area
Name: Kaipawa Trig Track

LocationString: Located in Elsthorpe and Mohi Bush Scenic Reserves
Name: Kairakau Loop Track
Introduction:
A great opportunity to walk through mature lowland
podocarp forest with excellent examples of kahikatea,
matai, miro and totara.
Parks: Elsthorpe and Mohi Bush Scenic Reserves

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only.
LocationString: Located in Herekino Forest
Name: Kaitaia Walkway - route
Introduction: Take a 1 hour 30 minute return walk on the Kaitaia Walkway to a lovely kauri grove.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Exit point of the Kaitaia Walkway.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only.
LocationString: Located in Herekino Forest
Name: Kaitaia Walkway - short walk
Introduction: Take a 1 hour 30 minute return walk on the Kaitaia Walkway to a lovely kauri grove.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Juvenile kauri.

LocationString: Located in Egmont National Park
Name: Kaitake Range walking tracks
Introduction: The Kaitake Range is remarkably different from the rest of Egmont National Park with its variety of warmth-loving semi-coastal forest.

LocationString: Located in Great Barrier Island Aotea

LocationString: Located in Kaituna wetland
Name: Kaituna Kayak Trail
Introduction: Increased water levels in the Kaituna reserve mean that kayaking is now possible.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Kayaker passing a stand of raupo.

WalkingTime: 8-9 hr or shorter walks from 20 min to 2 hr
LocationString: Located in Kahurangi National Park
Name: Kaituna Track
Introduction: Beautiful native forest and gold-mining relics are the main attractions of the Kaituna Valley.

LocationString: Located in Banks Peninsula area
Name: Kaituna Valley Packhorse Hut Track
Introduction: This is the shortest track to Packhorse Hut and is suitable for small children and family groups.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Start of Packhorse Hut Track through farmland. Image: Harley James

LocationString: Located in Kaituna wetland
Name: Kaituna Wetland Loop Track
Introduction: Two loop tracks and a wonderful viewing hide have been built so you get up close and personal with the wetland.

LocationString: Located in Kakepuku Mountain Historic Reserve
Name: Kakepuku Track
Introduction: The Kakepuku Track in Kakepuku Historic Reserve climbs up through bush to the summit of Kakepuku, an old volcano.

LocationString: Located in East Egmont area, Egmont National Park
Name: Kamahi Loop Track
Introduction: Discover 'goblin forest' on this short walk.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Kamahi Forest, Egmont National Park. Photo: FraserElliot | Creative Commons.

LocationString: Located in Lake Kaniere Scenic Reserve
Name: Kaniere Water Race Walkway
Introduction:
The Kaniere Water Race Walkway provides an opportunity for
a pleasant bush walk in an area that is rich in history.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: A walker enjoys the view at Lake Kaniere.

LocationString: Located in Pirongia Forest Park
Name: Kaniwhaniwha: Kahikatea tree
Introduction: Walk to the tallest recorded native tree in New Zealand.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Kahikatea tree.

LocationString: Located in Pirongia Forest Park
Name: Kaniwhaniwha: Nikau Walk and Kaniwhaniwha Caves
Introduction: Follow a stream through beautiful native forest or walk through a 20 metre limestone cave.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Tramper, Nikau Walk

LocationString: Located in Bendigo area
Name: Knuka Track

IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Knuka Track summit.

LocationString: Located in Tararua Forest Park
Name: Kapakapanui Track
Introduction: The open summit of Kapakapanui is one of the best viewpoints in the Tararua Range.

LocationString: Located in Kapiti Island Nature Reserve
Name: Kapiti Island tracks and walks
Introduction: Enjoy listening to and spotting birds on walks in two areas of Kapiti Island.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Walkers on Kapiti Island.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only.
LocationString: Located in Te Paki Recreation Reserve
Name: Kapowairua (Spirits Bay) to Pandora
Introduction: This 3 hour walk along beautiful Spirits Bay takes you to Pandora where you can stop to observe shore birds or camp for the night.

LocationString: Located in Karakariki Scenic Reserve
Name: Karakariki Track
Introduction: Walk this track and look for fossils in the stream below the waterfall.

LocationString: Located in Kahurangi National Park
Name: Karamea area walks

IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Scotts Beach Lookout, Kohaihai.

LocationString: Located in Raglan area
Name: Karamu Walkway
Introduction: Superb 360 degree views and impressive limestone bluffs are features of this walk.

LocationString: Located in Kaimai Mamaku Forest Park, Karangahake Gorge
Name: Karangahake Gorge Historic Walkway

LocationString: Located in Kaimai Mamaku Forest Park, Karangahake Gorge
Name: Karangahake Windows Walk
Introduction: This spectacular walk passes through the relics of the Talisman and Crown mining operations in Karangahake Gorge.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Karangahake Windows Walk.

Alerts.Heading: Underground pumphouse closed
Alerts.Detail:
The underground Woodstock Pumphouse will remain closed until further notice.

Reviewed on 24 June 2016

LocationString: Located in Westland Tai Poutini National Park
Name: Karangarua and Douglas valleys routes
Introduction: The Karangarua and Douglas valleys offer hunters, trampers and mountaineers many challenging opportunities and rewards within the rugged backcountry environment of Westland Tai Poutini National Park.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Descending to the Karangarua River. Photo: AndrewJohnMitchell | Creative Commons | https://www.flickr.com/photos/10957060@N03/15785980164.

LocationString: Located in Karikari Peninsula
Name: Karikari Bay Walk
Introduction: Take a quick walk to a long, white sandy beach on Northland's Karikari Peninsula.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Karikari Beach. Photo: Eli Duke | CC BY-SA 2.0.

LocationString: Located in Karioi area, Pirongia Forest Park
Name: Karioi summit tracks
Introduction: Karioi is an ancient volcano and the views from the summit  are spectacular.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Lookout from a cliff-sided ridge, near the summit of Mt Karioi.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
LocationString: Located in Ruahine Forest Park
Name: Kashmir Road tramping tracks
Introduction: Kashmir Road climbs far and high into Ruahine Forest Park and provides quick access to the high country.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Stag Spur to Daphne Hut.

LocationString: Located in Coromandel Forest Park, Kauaeranga Valley
Name: Kauaeranga Kauri Trail (Pinnacles Walk)
Introduction: This popular walk leads to Pinnacles Hut, and on to the summit of the Pinnacles with spectacular views of the Coromandel Peninsula.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Summit of the Pinnacles, Kauaeranga Kauri Trail. Monty VanderBilt | CC BY-NC-SA 2.0.

Alerts.Heading: Billygoat Track - bridge removed
Alerts.Detail:
The bridge at the bottom of the Billygoat Track has been removed due to flood damage - visitors will need to wade across the river at this point. River crossings are not advisable during or after heavy rainfall.

The Webb Creek track option up to the Pinnacles Hut is unaffected by the removal of this bridge.

This alert is valid long term.

LocationString: Located in Coromandel Forest Park, Kauaeranga Valley
Name: Kauaeranga Valley short walks
Introduction: Youll find numerous short walks in the Kauaeranga Valley.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Walking in Kauaeranga Valley. Photo: easegill | CC BY-NC-SA 2.0.

LocationString: Located in Coromandel Forest Park, Kauaeranga Valley
Name: Kauaeranga Valley tramping tracks
Introduction: Find out about the tramping tracks in the Kauaeranga Valley area.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: View back to to the Pinnacles Hut. Photo: Kathrin Marks | CC BY-NC-ND 2.0.

Alerts.Heading: Access closed to Piraunui Track
Alerts.Detail:
Access to the Piraunui Track from Kauaeranga Valley Road and Kopu-Hikuai Road is closed until further notice.

Reviewed on 1 October 2015

Alerts.Heading: Billygoat Track - bridge removed
Alerts.Detail:
The bridge at the bottom of the Billygoat Track has been removed due to flood damage - visitors will need to wade across the river at this point. River crossings are not advisable during or after heavy rainfall.

The Webb Creek track option up to the Pinnacles Hut is unaffected by the removal of this bridge.

Name: Kauaeranga Valley walking tracks

IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Crossing the main Kauaeranga River at the Tarawaere swingbridge. Photo: Kathrin Marks | CC BY-NC-ND 2.0.

The bridge at the bottom of the Billygoat Track has been removed due to flood damage - visitors will need to wade across the river at this point. River crossings are not advisable during or after heavy rainfall.

The Webb Creek track option up to the Pinnacles Hut is unaffected by the removal of this bridge.

LocationString: Located in Coromandel Town area
Name: Kauri Block Track
Introduction: The Kauri Block walk on the Coromandel Peninsula follows a ridge through regenerating bush and native plantings.

LocationString: Located in Dargaville area
Name: Kauri Bushman's Walk

LocationString: Located in Tangihua Forest

Alerts.Heading: Tangihua Kauri Dam Walk closure
Alerts.Detail:
The Kauri Dam Walk is being upgraded in response to Kauri dieback disease and will be closed until further notice.

Work will take place during June and July and it is hoped that the track will be re-open after that.

Kauri dieback disease is killing our native kauri. It spreads by soil movement, but you can help prevent it.

Alerts.Heading: Reduced facilities and additional safety hazards from 28 April - 24 October 2016
Alerts.Detail:
The Great Walks season has ended on the Kepler Track.

From 28 April 2016 to 24 October 2016, facilities are greatly reduced and there are additional safety hazards to consider. Walking the track during this time should only be attempted by fit, experienced and well-equipped people. For more information see Walking the Kepler Track outside the Great Walks season.

Alerts.Heading: Slips affecting Wangapeka Track (and Leslie/Karamea Track)
Alerts.Detail:
• Western section: Heavy rains have dislodged storm damaged trees on the western section of the Wangapeka Track. This track traverses storm damaged terrain which has some windfallen trees and slips on a sector west of the Belltown Mananui Hut. Users should be fit and experienced to deal with these conditions. Care is required when traversing slip areas.

  • Lower section: Extreme caution required when crossing a large slip located approximately 1 hour 30 minutes walk from Rolling Junction road end. In October 2012 this massive slip created a 15 m high natural dam and a new lake approximately 1 km long and up to a depth of 20 m. When crossing the slip trampers should move quickly, following the marked route and if possible use a spotter to watch for falling rocks. In heavy rainfall, trampers downstream of the dam should move to at least 20 m above the Wangapeka river bed level if they see the water suddenly become discoloured.

Note: These slips also affect the Leslie/Karamea Track as it shares two entry/exit points with the Wangapeka Track.

This is a long term alert.

LocationString: Located in Waioeka Gorge Scenic Reserve

Snow present above bushline. Alpine skills essential and extreme care required.

Reviewed on 13 June 2016.

LocationString: Located in Kahurangi National Park, Mount Arthur area

LocationString: Located in Goldsborough (Waimea) - Kumara area

LocationString: Located in Dunedin area, Purakaunui/Waitati area

LocationString: Located in Waipoua Forest

LocationString: Located in Kaweka Forest Park

LocationString: Located in Remarkables Conservation Area

LocationString: Located in Lyell area

LocationString: Located in Te Kahui Kaupeka Conservation Park

LocationString: Located in Ruahine Forest Park

LocationString: Located in Mahia Peninsula Scenic Reserve

LocationString: Located in Mahinapua Scenic Reserve

LocationString: Located in Whangaroa area

LocationString: Located in Tangihua Forest

LocationString: Located in Karikari Peninsula

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
LocationString: Located in Kaweka Forest Park

LocationString: Located in Kaweka Forest Park

Alerts.Heading: Makahu Road closed
Alerts.Detail: Due to heavy rainfall the ford crossing on Makahu Road is closed.

LocationString: Located in Makara Beach area

Alerts.Heading: Rockfalls
Alerts.Detail:
There have been rockfalls in sections of the tracks - use caution when walking in this area.

Reviewed on 23 March 2016

LocationString: Located in Makarora area, Mount Aspiring National Park

LocationString: Located in Mahinapua Scenic Reserve

LocationString: Located in Manawatu Gorge Scenic Reserve

LocationString: Located in Manawatu Gorge Scenic Reserve

LocationString: Located in Manawatu Gorge Scenic Reserve

LocationString: Located in Tararua Forest Park

LocationString: Located in Puketi and Omahuta Forests

LocationString: Located in Morere area

LocationString: Located in Raetea Forest and Mangamuka Gorge Scenic Reserve

LocationString: Located in Piopio area

LocationString: Located in Whanganui National Park

LocationString: Located in Matiu/Somes Island

Introduction: Walk to the top of Matiu/Somes Island, to see gun emplacements built during World War II and enjoy 360 degree views.

LocationString: Located in Matiu/Somes Island

LocationString: Located in Maungakawa Scenic Reserve
Name: Maungakawa Scenic Reserve Loop Walk
Introduction: Enjoy fabulous views and plenty of birdlife on this short, well-formed, well-marked track.

WalkingTime: 1 hr 30 min to Maunganui Bluff | 5 hr to Waikara Beach
LocationString: Located in Dargaville area

Introduction: Climb up and over an ancient volcanic crater for some of the best views in the region - pass through some pristine coastal vegetation dominated by Pohutukawa.

LocationString: Located in Maungauika/North Head Historic Reserve
Name: Maungauika/North Head Historic Walk
Introduction: Explore defences that were placed on the headland to protect Auckland from feared Russian invasions.

LocationString: Located in Mavora Lakes Conservation Park
Name: Mavora - Greenstone Walkway
Introduction: This is a 50 km, four day tramping trip, linking the Mavora Lakes Camping Area with the Greenstone Track.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: North Mavora Lake and Carey's Hut. Photo: Lyn Trewella.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
LocationString: Located in Ruahine Forest Park
Name: McKinnon Hut Track
Introduction: Perched on the northern end of the Hikurangi Range in Ruahine Forest Park, McKinnon Hut is accessed via a long ridge climbing up from the Kawhatau Valley.

LocationString: Located in Catlins coastal area, Catlins Conservation Park
Name: McLean Falls Walk
Introduction: Walk to the spectacular McLean Falls though a variety of forest and shrub types.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: McLean Falls. Photo: Shellie Evans .

LocationString: Located in New Plymouth area
Name: Meeting of the Waters Scenic Reserve walks
Introduction: Enjoy a picnic and take one of the short walks in this family friendly reserve.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Araheke Bush Walk suspension bridge over the Waiwhakaiho River.

LocationString: Located in Hwea Conservation Park, Lindis Conservation Area
Name: Melina Ridge Track
Introduction: This is a classic mountain bike ride located in lower Ahuriri valley.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Melina Ridge Track on the south side of Mt Melina, Hawea Conservation Park.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
LocationString: Located in Ruahine Forest Park
Name: Mid Pohangina Hut Track
Introduction: Cross farmland and then sidle high above the picturesque Pohangina River in the Ruahine Forest Park before crossing the river and heading to the hut.

LocationString: Located in Catchpool Valley & Orongorongo Valley, Rimutaka Forest Park
Name: Middle Ridge Track
Introduction: This walking track links up with two popular tracks within Catchpool Valley.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: A greenhood orchid on the Middle Ridge Track. Photo: Jeremy Rolfe.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
LocationString: Located in Mikonui River - Kakapotahi River area
Name: Mikonui Catchment - Dickie Ridge/Upper Tuke River Route
Introduction: The Dickie Ridge/Tuke River Route provides a link to challenging alpine tramping opportunities and gives access to the Waitaha and Whitcombe Catchments.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: View from Dickie Spur Hut. Photo: Rachel Zurer | Creative Commons.

LocationString: Located in Fiordland National Park, Milford Road/Milford Sound area
Name: Milford Foreshore Walk
Introduction: Wander through beech forest and along the sandy foreshore of Milford Sound, learn about the area from interpretative visitor panels and enjoy fabulous views of Mitre Peak on this easy short walk.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Milford Sound foreshore and Mitre Peak. Photo: Ruth Harnup | CC BY 2.0.

LocationString: Located in Fiordland National Park, Milford Road/Milford Sound area
Name: Milford Sound Lookout Track
Introduction: Enjoy impressive views of stunning Milford Sound from a lookout on this short, easy walking track.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Milford Sound view from the Lookout Track.

LocationString: Located in Fiordland National Park
Name: Milford Track
Introduction: Experience 'the finest walk in the world' as you retrace the steps of early explorers on the world-renowed Milford Track.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Giants Gate Falls.

Alerts.Heading: Bridges removed
Alerts.Detail: Bridges are removed to avoid them being damaged by avalanches.  Those intending to walk the track need to be competent at crossing large, swift, icy rivers.

Alerts.Heading: Track diversion
Alerts.Detail:
• The main track is closed on the descent from Mackinnon Pass  use Emergency Track.  
  • Roaring Burn Bridge is limited to one person at a time.

Alerts.Heading: Reduced facilities and additional safety hazards from 29 April - 24 October 2016
Alerts.Detail:
The Great Walks season has ended on the Milford Track.

From 29 April 2016 to 24 October 2016, facilities are greatly reduced and there are additional safety hazards to consider. Walking the track during this time should only be attempted by fit, experienced and well-equipped people. For more information see Walking the Milford Track outside the Great Walks season.

LocationString: Located in Wanaka area
Name: Minaret Burn Track
Introduction: This walk passes through native forest and bush, crossing burns (streams) and giving access to Lake Wanaka itself.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Minaret Burn track.

LocationString: Located in Arthur's Pass National Park
Name: Minchin  Pass Route
Introduction: This route travels the eastern and northern flanks of Arthur's Pass National Park.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Looking up Minchin Stream towards Minchin Pass.

Alerts.Heading: Heavy snow and ice in all alpine terrains
Alerts.Detail: Very heavy snow and ice on all tracks / routes above the bushline. Do not attempt to access these areas without alpine / avalanche awareness and skills. Iceaxe and crampons are essential.

Alerts.Heading: Casey Hut burnt down
Alerts.Detail:
Casey Hut burnt down on 3 October 2015. If you visit this area we recommended you carry a tent. The 8-bunk Trust/Poulter Hut is a further 1 hour 30 minutes up the Poulter valley and requires river crossings.

This is a long term alert.

LocationString: Located in Arthur's Pass National Park
Name: Mingha - Deception Route
Introduction: This route is a classic traverse of the Southern Alps, crossing over Goat Pass.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Goat Pass.

Alerts.Heading: Mingha carpark has moved 500 m south
Alerts.Detail:
The Mingha carpark and the old access track across the railway line to the Mingha and Edwards Valley has been closed off due to SH73 realignment work. A new temporary carpark has been developed at the shingle pit area near the Bealey Rail Bridge, approximately 500 m south of the old carpark.

From the new carpark there is a marked walking track across the railway line immediately adjacent to the rail bridge on to the causeway, then up the causeway to connect with the old track. Note there are construction crews working in the same area as the new carpark.

Long-term alert - no change anticipated until September 2016

LocationString: Located in Fox Glacier area, Westland Tai Poutini National Park
Name: Minnehaha Walk
Introduction: This delightful short walk follows a stream through the rainforest.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Person on Minnehaha Walk. Photo: anoldent | https://www.flickr.com/photos/anoldent/.

LocationString: Located in Fiordland National Park, Milford Road/Milford Sound area
Name: Mirror Lakes Walk
Introduction: Stroll among small lakes with lovely reflective views of the Earl Mountains on this easy access short walk off Milford Road.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Mirror Lake. Photo: Chris Ford | CC BY-NC 2.0.

LocationString: Located in Fiordland National Park, Milford Road/Milford Sound area
Name: Mistake Creek Track
Introduction: This difficult tramping track leads from the Milford Road and up the Mistake Creek Valley through beech forest to the river flats.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Mistake Creek Track looking toward U Pass. Photo: Lyn Trewella.

DogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.
LocationString: Located in Tararua Forest Park
Name: Mitre Flats Track
Introduction: The Barra Track follows the Waingawa River to Mitre Flats and Mitre Flats Hut.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
LocationString: Located in Waioeka Conservation Area
Name: Moanui, Tawa, Koranga Track
Introduction: This tramp, just 1 hour 30 minutes from Gisborne or Opotiki, can be tackled as a loop, or as two separate return trips to Tawa or Koranga Forks Huts.

Alerts.Heading: Slip between Moanui road end and Tawa Hut
Alerts.Detail:
There is a 1015 metre slip 30 minutes from Tawa Hut, going towards the "Burn" and Moanui Road end. This slip is dangerous with a steep drop-off. Take extreme care. Do not attempt to cross it.

The track has been diverted up and around the slip, follow the orange markers. Large orange markers indicate the entries to this diversion. The diversion will take approximately 10 minutes. Further work will be carried out on this diversion during summer 2016/17.

Reviewed on 2 May 2016.

LocationString: Located in Moeraki area
Name: Moeraki Boulders Walk
Introduction: Take a walk to the Moeraki Boulders - geological marvels, exposed by erosion of sedimentary rocks laid down from 65 to 13 million years ago.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Moeraki Boulders.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
LocationString: Located in Haast, Paringa and Moeraki Rivers area
Name: Moeraki Valley Track
Introduction: The Moeraki Valley offers good tramping for the fit and experienced.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Moeraki River. Photo: C Vervoorn.
Parks: Haast, Paringa and Moeraki Rivers area

LocationString: Located in Whirinaki Te Pua-a-Tne Conservation Park
Name: Moerangi Mountain Bike Track
Introduction: The Moerangi Track is a 35 km dual purpose track, which attracts both mountain bikers and trampers to experience a multi-day adventure deep in the wonderful 'Jurassic' Whirinaki Te Pua-a-Tne Conservation Park.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Mountain biking the Moerangi Mountain Bike Track.

Alerts.Heading: No vehicle access to Okahu road end
Alerts.Detail:
Due to heavy rain the Okahu Road has washed out in several places so there is no vehicle access  to the Okahu road end. The Okahu ford has been damaged  NZTM2000 coordinates: GR E1931944, N5713447.

The track is walkable with caution as far as Skips (Whangatawhia) Hut. Other tracks in the area are still to be assessed.

Track users will have to walk about an extra 2 km from the ford to the road end.

Alerts.Heading: Moerangi Mountain Bike Track damage
Alerts.Detail:
Following heavy rain in March 2016, the track has changed to Intermediate: Grade 3-4. It is recommended for riders with a high level of fitness and experience. Some sections have been damaged so riders need to be extra cautious when navigating along the track.

For more information contact the DOC office at Murupara, phone +64 7 366 1080.

Reviewed 29 June 2016

LocationString: Located in Whirinaki Te Pua-a-Tne Conservation Park
Name: Moerangi Track
Introduction: The Moerangi Track is a 35 km dual purpose track, which attracts both mountain bikers and trampers to experience a multi-day adventure deep in the wonderful 'Jurassic' Whirinaki Te Pua-a-Tne Conservation Park.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Trampers on the Moerangi Track.

Alerts.Heading: No vehicle access to Okahu road end
Alerts.Detail:
Due to heavy rain the Okahu Road has washed out in several places so there is no vehicle access  to the Okahu road end. The Okahu ford has been damaged  NZTM2000 coordinates: GR E1931944, N5713447.

The track is walkable with caution as far as Skips (Whangatawhia) Hut. Other tracks in the area are still to be assessed.

Track users will have to walk about an extra 2 km from the ford to the road end.

LocationString: Located in Elsthorpe and Mohi Bush Scenic Reserves
Name: Mohi Bush Scenic Reserve walks

IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Mohi Bush Scenic Reserve. Photo: Ellen Fitzsimons.
Parks: Elsthorpe and Mohi Bush Scenic Reserves

LocationString: Located in Warkworth area
Name: Moirs Hill Walkway

LocationString: Located in Mokaihaha Ecological Area
Name: Mokaihaha Track
Introduction: Large podocarps and a chance to hear kaka and other native birdlife while walking along the Mokaihaha Track which takes you past Lake Rotohokahoka.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: North Island kaka. Photo: Ross Henderson.

LocationString: Located in Queenstown area
Name: Moke Lake Loop Track
Introduction: This popular short, undulating walk through grassland is surrounded by mountains and goes right round the lake.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Moke Lake.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
LocationString: Located in Moki and Makino Conservation Areas
Name: Moki Track
Introduction: The track was developed with wheelbarrows, picks and shovels as early as 1910.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Moki stock tunnel, Moki Track. Photo: Tim Weston.

LocationString: Located in Muriwai and Te Henga area
Name: Mokoroa Falls Track
Introduction: Walk the Mokoroa Falls Track to view the falls from a lookout platform.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Mokoroa Falls. Photo: itravelNZ | CC BY 2.0.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only.
LocationString: Located in Muriwai and Te Henga area
Name: Mokoroa Stream Track
Introduction: The Mokoroa Stream Track is a challenging loop walk which comes off the Goldie Bush Walkway.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Mokoroa Stream Walk. Photo: Stefan Marks | CC BY-NC-ND 2.0.

LocationString: Located in Molesworth Station
Name: Molesworth Station tramping tracks
Introduction: There are five tramping tracks accessible from the Acheron Road; from short tracks from the cob buildings at Molesworth and Acheron to longer tracks with panorama views.

LocationString: Located in A'Deanes Bush & Monckton Scenic Reserves
Name: Monckton Walkway
Introduction: Enjoy a short walk through native forest rich in kahikatea, totara, beech, matai, tawa and kowhai.

LocationString: Located in Fiordland National Park, Lake Manapouri area
Name: Monument Track

IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Starting up the Monument Track.

LocationString: Located in Southern Paparoa Range
Name: Moonlight Pack Track
Introduction: The Moonlight Pack Track offers the opportunity to see reminders of the gold mining history of the area, and to walk through West Coast native beech forest.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Historic relic on the Moonlight Track. Photo: Gordon Roberts.

LocationString: Located in Southern Paparoa Range
Name: Moonlight/Croesus Route
Introduction: The Moonlight/Croesus Route gives panoramic views of the Paparoa Ranges.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Tramper crossing over the Paparoa tops. Photo: Juergen Schacke

LocationString: Located in Fiordland National Park, Milford Road/Milford Sound area
Name: Moraine Creek Route
Introduction: This challenging tramping route leads up the Moraine Creek from the Hollyford Road to beautiful Lake Adelaide in an impressive glacial basin.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Lunch at Lake Adelaide, Moraine Creek. Photo: Bruce Webster.

LocationString: Located in Fox Glacier area, Westland Tai Poutini National Park
Name: Moraine Walk
Introduction: Explore old moraine surfaces on this easy, short walk, south of Fox Glacier township.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Moraine Walk.

LocationString: Located in Arrowtown area, Wanaka area
Name: Motatapu Track
Introduction: The Motatapu Track follows much of an historic route that linked the Wanaka and Arrowtown areas.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Motatapu track.

LocationString: Located in Motuarohia Island Recreation Reserve
Name: Motuarohia (Roberton) Island Track

LocationString: Located in Motueka area
Name: Motueka Sandspit

LocationString: Located in Motukawanui Island Scenic Reserve

LocationString: Located in Whangarei Heads area
Name: Motukiore Island Walk
Introduction: This pleasant and easy walk takes you around the coastline across a causeway to Motukiore Island, and is a great summer family outing.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Motukiore Island.

DogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.
LocationString: Located in Turangi area
Name: Motuoapa Cliff Lookout Walk

IntroductionThumbnailAltText: View of Lake Taupo from the Moutoapa cliff lookout.

LocationString: Located in Motuora Recreation Reserve
Name: Motuora Island walks

LocationString: Located in Moturua Island Scenic Reserve
Name: Moturua Island Track

IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Moturua island.

LocationString: Located in Motutapu Island Recreation Reserve

Introduction: Take a walk on the Pohutukawa Track to view both young and mature pohutukawa, or make a day of it and walk the Motutapu Loop Track.

LocationString: Located in Motutapu Island Recreation Reserve

LocationString: Located in Motutapu Island Recreation Reserve

LocationString: Located in Whananaki area

LocationString: Located in Whataroa area

LocationString: Located in Glenorchy area
Name: Mount Alfred
Introduction: A good zigzag track climbs three quarters of the way up Mt Alfred and from there you'll follow a marked route to the bushline.

LocationString: Located in Kahurangi National Park, Mount Arthur area
Name: Mount Arthur summit
Introduction: Climb to the top of Mt Arthur (1795 m) for panoramic views.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only.

LocationString: Located in Mount Auckland area
Name: Mount Auckland Atuanui Walkway
Introduction: Take a walk to the summit of Mount Auckland (Atuanui) through regenerating native forest.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: View from Mt Auckland/Atuanui.

LocationString: Located in Hakatere Conservation Park

Introduction: Climb to the top of Mount Barrosa (1364 m) for good views of the surrounding countryside.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: View from the summit of Mt Barrosa.

LocationString: Located in Makarora area, Mount Aspiring National Park

Alerts.Detail:
Snow present above bushline. Alpine skills essential and extreme care required.

Reviewed on 13 June 2016.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
LocationString: Located in Mount Damper and Waitaanga Conservation Area
Name: Mount Damper Falls Walk
Introduction: This short walk leads to Mount Damper Falls, one of the highest falls in the North Island.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Mt Damper Falls. PHOTO:
Parks: Mount Damper and Waitaanga Conservation Area

LocationString: Located in Mount Damper and Waitaanga Conservation Area
Name: Mount Damper to Te Rerepahupahu Falls track
Introduction: This track to Te Rerepahupahu Falls is recommended for fit and experienced trampers only.

Alerts.Heading: Tatu to Te Rerepahupahu Falls Track closed
Alerts.Detail:
For safety reasons Tatu to Te Rerepahupahu Falls Track has been closed permanently. The track is overgrown, eroded, and navigation is difficult. 

This is a long term alert.

Parks: Mount Damper and Waitaanga Conservation Area

LocationString: Located in Westland Tai Poutini National Park
Name: Mount Fox Route

LocationString: Located in Mount Grey/Maukatere Conservation Area

LocationString: Located in Raukumara Conservation Park

Mount Hikurangi Hut is closed for maintenance and there is no public acess to the hut until 31 July 2016.

Phone Te Runanganui O Ngati Porou on +64 6 867 9960 if you have any questions.

This is a long-term alert.

LocationString: Located in Mount Hutt area

LocationString: Located in Whangarei Heads area

LocationString: Located in White Cliffs and Mount Messenger Conservation Area

LocationString: Located in Tongariro National Park
Name: Mount Ngauruhoe summit climb
Introduction: The near perfect volcanic cone of Mt Ngauruhoe entices many visitors to its summit.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Mount Ngauruhoe summit climb.Mount Ngauruhoe summit climb. Image: Fanny Leduc | Creative Commons.

LocationString: Located in Nelson Lakes National Park
Name: Mount Robert Circuit
Introduction: This loop track around the northern face of Mt Robert offers spectacular views over Lake Rotoiti.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Walkers looking across Lake Rotoiti from Pinchgut Track.

LocationString: Located in Tongariro National Park
Name: Mount Ruapehu Crater climb
Introduction: A fantastic climb to the heart of an active volcano, this is an unformed route, and requires alpine experience and equipment.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Climbers on Tuwharetoa glacier. Photo: Dave Conley.

Alerts.Heading: Volcanic alert on Mt Ruapehu
Alerts.Detail:
DOC recommends people do not enter the crater basin area beyond Dome Ridge or low points on the active crater rim, or camp anywhere in the summit craters or in the upper parts of valleys draining the crater basin. 

Normal operations continue for visitors to all areas outside the summit craters and upper valleys.

More information
  • Ruapehu volcanic alert levels - GNS website
  • Media release 24 May 2016: Volcanic advisory modified for Ruapehus summit craters area 

Updated 21 June 2016

LocationString: Located in Mount Aspiring National Park
Name: Mount Shrimpton Track
Introduction: A good, steep bush walk to the uplands of the McKerrow Range.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Mt Shrimpton above the bushline. Photo: V Sprey.

LocationString: Located in Hakatere Conservation Park, Mount Somers area
Name: Mount Somers summit
Introduction: Climb to the summit of Mount Somers for 360 degrees views.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: View from the track to Mt Somers summit.

LocationString: Located in Hakatere Conservation Park, Mount Somers area
Name: Mount Somers Track
