LocationString: Located in Pelorus and Kenepuru Sounds area
Name: Mount Stokes Track
Introduction: This tramping track in Kenepuru Sound follows a ridge to the summit (1203 m), the highest point in the Sounds.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: View from Te Mahia, Kenepuru Sound. Photo: P.Croft.

LocationString: Located in Hakatere Conservation Park
Name: Mount Sunday Track
Introduction: Walk to the top of Mount Sunday for expansive views of the surrounding countryside.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: South view from the summit of Mount Sunday.

LocationString: Located in Egmont National Park, North Egmont area
Name: Mount Taranaki  Summit Track
Introduction: The Mount Taranaki summit should only be attempted in good weather by experienced trampers with proper equipment.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Walking up the Puffer - Summit Tramp. Photo: Kay Davies.

Alerts.Heading: Mount Taranaki Summit Track - winter conditions
Alerts.Detail:
Winter is here expect snow and ice on the mountain. It is not safe to attempt to climb to the summit or upper mountain without ice axe, crampons and alpine mountaineering experience.

Contact the Egmont National Park Visitor Centre for up-to-date conditions prior to heading out on the mountain  the weather and mountain conditions are very changeable.

Reviewed 8 July 2016

LocationString: Located in Kaimai Mamaku Forest Park
Name: Mount Te Aroha tracks
Introduction: A series of walks up and around Mount Te Aroha offer stunning views and give access to the Kaimai Mamaku Forest Park.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: View from the summit of Mount Te Aroha.

DogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.
LocationString: Located in Mount Thomas Forest Conservation Area
Name: Mount Thomas walking tracks
Introduction: The walking tracks of Mount Thomas give you options ranging from one hour family-friendly round trips to longer walks to the summit of Mount Thomas.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: View from Mount Thomas. Image: Harley James

LocationString: Located in Lake Kaniere Scenic Reserve
Name: Mount Tuhua Track
Introduction: This is a steep tramp to the open tussock peak of Mt.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: One of the view points from Mt Tuhua.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only.
LocationString: Located in Dargaville area
Name: Mount Tutamoe Track
Introduction: Climb through Kaihu Forest to the top of Mount Tutamoe and you will be rewarded by stunning, panoramic views.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Stream, Kaihu Forest. Photo: Trevor Page | CC BY-NC-ND 2.0.

LocationString: Located in Mount William area
Name: Mount William Walkway
Introduction: Enjoy the views from the summit of Mount William, just south of the Bombay Hills.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Mt William Walkway. Photo: Stephen | Auckland Hiking Group

LocationString: Located in Fiordland National Park, Hollyford Valley area, Lake Monowai/Borland Road area, Lake Te Anau area, Milford Road/Milford Sound area
Name: Mountain biking in Fiordland
Introduction: Find out about places to go mountain biking in the Fiordland area, including on formed roads and selected local tracks (but sorry, no bikes are allowed on tracks in Fiordland National Park).

LocationString: Located in Alford Scenic Reserve
Name: Mt Alford Track
Introduction: Passing through Alford Scenic Reserve, this track takes you to the summit of Mt Alford.

LocationString: Located in Fiordland National Park, Lake Monowai/Borland Road area
Name: Mt Burns Tarns Track
Introduction: This enjoyable, short tramping track offers a superb setting and views from Mt Burns, Monowai, Fiordland.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Up in the tops near the Borland Saddle.

LocationString: Located in Queenstown area
Name: Mt Crichton Loop Track
Introduction: Twelve Mile Creek Gorge was worked intensively by gold miners and you can still see signs of sluicing.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Mt Crichton Track.

Alerts.Heading: Mt Crichton Loop Track remedial work
Alerts.Detail: Throughout July there will be remedial work on the Mt Crichton Loop Track. This may cause delays to walkers for 510 mins.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
LocationString: Located in Mount Richmond Forest Park
Name: Mt Fishtail Route
Introduction: Climb up to Mt Fishtail (1643 m) via Fishtail Hut.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Mt Fishtail Route.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
LocationString: Located in Ka Whata Tu o Rakihouia Clarence
Name: Mt Fyffe and the Seaward Kaikoura Range
Introduction: Summer-bare or plastered with winters snowy coat, Mount Fyffe and the Seaward Kaikoura Range dominate the Kaikoura skyline.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Kaikoura Range from Mt Fyffe summit. PHOTO: Jake Osborne | Creative Commons.
Parks: Ka Whata Tu o Rakihouia Clarence

DogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.
LocationString: Located in Holdsworth area, Tararua Forest Park
Name: Mt Holdsworth - Jumbo Circuit
Introduction: The classic Mt Holdsworth - Jumbo Circuit is a two to three day tramp involving a climb through beech-podocarp forest to some of the best alpine tops travel in the Tararua Forest Park.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: From Powell Hut heading up towards Mt Holdsworth. PHOTO: Malcolm Peacey.

Alerts.Heading: Atiwhakatu Track slip
Alerts.Detail:
A section of re-routed track is subsiding on the Jumbo Hut - Holdsworth Lodge section of the circuit. Proceed with caution when walking along this slip section.

This is a long term alert. Reviewed 28 June 2016.

WalkingTime: 2 - 3 hr one way | 3 - 4 hr 30 min one way
LocationString: Located in Whakaari Conservation Area
Name: Mt Judah / Heather Jock Tracks
Introduction: Scheelite mining history, open tussock country and grand views await on these tracks - with the option of staying overnight in the basic Heather Jock Hut.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: View from Bonnie Jean Hut

LocationString: Located in Catchpool Valley & Orongorongo Valley, Rimutaka Forest Park
Name: Mt Matthews
Introduction: Fit trampers can climb the tallest peak in the Rimutaka range (941m) and the nearest to Wellington.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Mt Matthews from the Orongorongo Valley. Photo: Steve Sutton.

LocationString: Located in Whakaari Conservation Area
Name: Mt McIntosh Loop Track
Introduction: A steep overnight tramp with magnificent views through open tussock land.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: View from Mt McIntosh Loop

LocationString: Located in Catchpool Valley & Orongorongo Valley, Rimutaka Forest Park
Name: Mt McKerrow
Introduction: Get panoramic views of Wainuiomata and the Hutt Valley as you climb to the top of Mt McKerrow.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Mt McKerrow. Photo: Steve Sutton.

LocationString: Located in Mount Ngongotaha Scenic Reserve
Name: Mt Ngongotaha Jubilee Track
Introduction: The only walking track up to the summit of Mt Ngongotaha.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Tramping club members enjoying large rimu tree.

Alerts.Heading: Wind fallen trees preventing safe access
Alerts.Detail: There are wind fallen trees on Mt Ngongotaha Jubilee Track preventing safe public access. Rangers are on their way to assess a safe way to remedy the situation.

LocationString: Located in Mount Ngongotaha Scenic Reserve
Name: Mt Ngongotaha Nature Loop Track
Introduction: The Loop Track is a short walk orientated towards families or school groups to provide an experience close to town showcasing the beautiful flora and fauna of Mt Ngongotaha for all to see.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Local school utilising the opportunity of having a nature walk in close proximity.

LocationString: Located in Hunters Hills area
Name: Mt Nimrod Track
Introduction: Walk to a cascading waterfall and enjoy gorgeous views out to the coast.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Waterfall, Mt Nimrod.

Distance: Courthouse Flat to Granity Pass Hut - 8.3 km
WalkingTime: Northern access: 9 hr, Southern access 7 hr
LocationString: Located in Kahurangi National Park
Name: Mt Owen tracks and routes
Introduction: At 1875m Mt Owen is the highest peak in Kahurangi National Park and on a fine day the views from this peak are spectacular.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: View from Mt Owen.

Alerts.Heading: Caution on Dart River ford - access to the Wangapeka and Mt Owen
Alerts.Detail:
The Dart River ford has filled up with silt and small rocks and the river is flowing over the ford, even at low water levels. Given the amount of silt upstream of the ford, Tasman District Council have advised they can no longer keep this ford free from gravel migration .

Drivers need to be cautious and assess the flow before driving across the ford.

This is a long term alert.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
LocationString: Located in Mount Richmond Forest Park
Name: Mt Richmond routes
Introduction: These tracks provide access to Mt Richmond (1760 m) and can be combined for weekend round trip.

Alerts.Heading: Mt Fell Hut relocated and closed
Alerts.Detail:
Mt Fell hut has been relocated to a site approximately 500 m from its current site which was on an active slip. The hut is closed as it is a building site and on temporary foundations. It is planned to reopen by Christmas 2016.

This may affect walkers traversing Mt Fell and Mt Richmond.

This is a long term alert.

LocationString: Located in Remarkables Conservation Area
Name: Mt Rosa Track
Introduction: Starting with a steady climb to Mt Rosa, the track crosses the top with great views of the Nevis Bluff, the Kawarau Gorge and the lower Wakatipu Basin.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: View from Mt Rosa Track. Photo: Tyler Rose.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
LocationString: Located in Mount Richmond Forest Park
Name: Mt Sunday/Mt Riley Route
Introduction: Pass over Mt Sunday (1310 m) and Mt Riley (1314 m) on this circuit track.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only.
WalkingTime: 1 hr 30 min one way to summit or 3 hr 30 min one way to Rodney Rd
LocationString: Located in Warkworth area

Introduction: Tramp up to the summit of Mt Tamahunga through regenerating native forest.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Funghi at Mt Tamahunga. Photo: Martin Saunders.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
LocationString: Located in Kaimanawa Forest Park
Name: Mt Urchin Track
Introduction: Mount Urchin offers an easily accessible wilderness of beautiful beech forest, incredible views and a real alpine environment.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Urchin Trig.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
LocationString: Located in Mount Richmond Forest Park

Alerts.Heading: Winter conditions
Alerts.Detail: Snow and ice are present on this route. Reaching the hut requires a good level of mountaineering experience, including walking on ice and snow with ice axe and crampons, route finding and using an avalanche transceiver, probe and shovel. Call in to the Aoraki/Mount Cook visitor centre for advice on conditions.

LocationString: Located in Murchison area

IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Muriwai Walk.

LocationString: Located in Russell area

Alerts.Heading: Rabbit control operations
Alerts.Detail:
Rabbit control operations using Pinedon poison will take place from 15 July 2016 in the following areas: 

  • Albert Town Conservation Area
  • Hawea River Marginal Strip
  • Butterfields Wildlife Management Area
  • Clutha River Conservation Area/Marginal strip
  • Scenic Reserve/Covenant Area
  • The Nook Scenic Reserve
  • Contact Scenic Reserve
  • Lower Lindis Conservation Area
  • Mata-Au Scientific Reserve.

Warning signs will be removed when the areas are declared non toxic (13 months after the bait has been laid).

If you see a warning sign about the pesticide Pindone:

  • do not touch pellets
  • watch Children at all times
  • do not eat animals from this area or from within a 2 km "buffer zone" outside the operational boundary.

Only when the warning signs have been removed is the all clear given and normal activities in the area can occur.

For further information contact Patrik Eschenmoser: peschenmoser@doc.govt.nz.

Alerts.Heading: Snow and icy conditions in Egmont National Park
Alerts.Detail:
Winter has arrived in Egmont National Park and there are additional safety hazards to consider.

It's a good idea to check the mountain conditions and contact Egmont National Park Visitor Centre before heading up the mountain.

If you are planning a visit make sure you are prepared for the cold, wet winter conditions.

Alerts.Heading: Difficult access to beach at the north end of Mason Bay
Alerts.Detail:
Access along the north end of Mason Bay beach may only be possible at low tide. If you can't get down safely to the beach you will have to walk 6 hours back to Big Hellfire Hut or find shelter to see if conditions improve the next day. 

Check conditions with the Rakiura National Park Visitor Centre before walking the track. 

See more information about when you can access the beach. 

This is a long term alert.

Alerts.Heading: Otaika Valley Walkway closure
Alerts.Detail:
The Otaika Valley Walkway is being upgraded in response to kauri dieback disease and will be closed until further notice. Work will take place during June and July and it is hoped that the track will reopen after that.

The northern section through private land from Raumanga Heights Drive through to the reserve boundary will remain open, though only as a single access track. Those walking this track will need to return the way they came.

Alerts.Heading: Otaki Gorge Road closed
Alerts.Detail:
Otaki Gorge Road is closed due a slip. Do not attempt to walk across the slip. The slip is unstable with potential rock falls.

The best access to Otaki Forks is via the Otaki Forks emergency access track, starting from Shields Flat Historic Reserve carpark.

Alternative campsites are Catchpool Valley and Holdsworth.

Work to restore road access will start towards the end of March 2016. It is expected to be completed and the road reopened some time after July 2016. More on the Kapiti Coast District Council website.

This alert is valid long term. Reviewed 6 July 2016.

Alerts.Heading: Mt Fell Hut relocated and closed
Alerts.Detail:
Mt Fell hut has been relocated to a site approximately 500 m from its current site which was on an active slip. The hut is closed as it is a building site and on temporary foundations. It is planned to reopen by Christmas 2016.

This may affect walkers traversing Mt Fell and Mt Richmond.

This is a long term alert.

Alerts.Heading: Pukenui Forest Loop Track closure
Alerts.Detail:
The Pukenui Forest Loop Track is being upgraded in response to Kauri dieback disease and will be closed until further notice. Work will take place during June and July and it is hoped that the track will be re-open after that.

The Taraire Ridge Track will remain partially open, though only as a single access track. Sections of this track will be closed where it intersects with the Pukenui Forest Loop. Those walking this track will need to return the way they came. Whangarei District Council tracks will still be accessible from the Taraire Ridge Track.

Kauri dieback disease is killing our native kauri. It spreads by soil movement, but you can help prevent it.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only.

LocationString: Located in Motutapu Island , Rangitoto Island
Name: Rangitoto Motutapu Track: Guided walk
Introduction: Experience a world of contrasts as you journey through Aucklands largest, most diverse island sanctuaries.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Collecting pipi on the Rangitoto Motutapu guided walk.

LocationString: Located in Colonial Knob Scenic Reserve
Name: Rangituhi/Colonial Knob Walk
Introduction: Climb to the summit of this 468 metre peak and on a clear day you can see from the Inland Kaikoura Range in the south to Mt Taranaki in the north-west.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: View over Porirua from Colonial Knob Walk.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
LocationString: Located in Ruahine Forest Park
Name: Rangiwahia Hut - Deadmans Track
Introduction: An easy to moderate overnight tramp to Rangiwahia Hut on the Whanahuia Range in Ruahine Forest Park.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
LocationString: Located in Ruahine Forest Park
Name: Rangiwahia Hut Track
Introduction: A popular, easy overnight tramp to the tussock tops of the Whanahuia Range in the Ruahine Forest Park.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Rangiwahia Hut Track. Photo: Pierre Roudier | Creative Commons.

LocationString: Located in Kaimai Mamaku Forest Park
Name: Rapurapu Kauri Track
Introduction: This walking track is a beautiful cool, retreat during the summer months.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Boardwalk at the Rapurapu kauri trees.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only.
LocationString: Located in Te Paki Recreation Reserve
Name: Rarawa Beach Walk
Introduction: This short walking track takes you to Rarawa beach.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Rarawa Beach Walk.

LocationString: Located in New Plymouth area
Name: Ratapihipihi Scenic Reserve walk
Introduction: Walk through an outstanding example of a subtropical rain forest with kohekohe, tawa, puketea and nikau palms.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Ratapihipihi Scenic Reserve.

LocationString: Located in Takaka area
Name: Rawhiti Cave Track
Introduction: Rawhiti Cave is nationally significant as it has possibly the most diverse and extensive entrance - and twilight-zone flora of any cave in New Zealand.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Rawhiti Cave. Photo: Garry Holz.

LocationString: Located in Victoria Forest Park
Name: Reefton mountain bike tracks
Introduction: The beech forest and historic goldfields surrounding Reefton offer an excellent range of mountain biking opportunities.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Kirwans Surprise Track.

LocationString: Located in Victoria Forest Park
Name: Reefton short walks
Introduction: Reefton is a great place to base yourself and your family.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Golden Fleece Walk. Photo: Jason Blair.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
LocationString: Located in Victoria Forest Park
Name: Reefton walking tracks - Victoria Forest Park
Introduction: There are a number of walking tracks in the Victoria Forest Park area that will get you into some interesting places such as Waiuta, Inangahua suspension bridge and Murray Creek.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Murray Creek girls walking.

LocationString: Located in Mount Aspiring National Park
Name: Rees-Dart Track
Introduction:
See spectacular mountain scenery, forest
and alpine vegetation, glacier-fed rivers and the Dart
Glacier on the Rees-Dart Track.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Rees-Dart Track. Photo: Ell Duke | Creative Commons.

Alerts.Heading: Upper Snowy Creek bridge removed
Alerts.Detail: The bridge over the upper Snowy Creek between Rees Saddle and Dart Hut has been removed for winter. It will be reinstated in spring when the snow clears.

Alerts.Heading: Snow present above bushline
Alerts.Detail:
Snow present above bushline. Alpine skills essential and extreme care required.

Reviewed on 13 June 2016.

Alerts.Heading: Rees Valley - 25 Mile Hut removed
Alerts.Detail: The derelict 25 Mile Hut in the Rees Valley has been removed. Camping on the old hut site is not permitted - the site is on private land.

Alerts.Heading: Partial closure on the Dart Track
Alerts.Detail:
Due to an active land slide, the Dart Track is partially closed to walking. The section between Bedford Bridge and Sandy Bluff is impassable. Contact the Queenstown Visitor Centre, +64 3 442 7935 or queenstownvc@doc.govt.nz, to discuss your options.

Work will be carried out during winter 2016, and the aim is to reopen the closed section by November 2016.

The rest of the Rees Dart Track is open.

This is a long term alert. Reviewed on 27 April 2016.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
LocationString: Located in Ruahine Forest Park
Name: Renfrew Roadend to Table Flat Roadend
Introduction: Climb up and over the tussock tops of the Whanahuia Range in Ruahine Forest Park then drop down to follow the Oroua River valley.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
LocationString: Located in Moki and Makino Conservation Areas
Name: Rerekapa Track
Introduction: This track was made around 1910 by road workers using wheelbarrows, picks and shovels.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Rerekapa Falls. Photo: Tim Weston.

LocationString: Located in Lake Tekapo area
Name: Richmond Trail
Introduction: Enjoy stunning views of Lake Tekapo while walking or riding this track.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Richmond Trail.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only.
LocationString: Located in Waipoua Forest
Name: Rickers Walk
Introduction: This track is closed indefinitely.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Kauri forest, Northland. Photo: Peter Anderson.

LocationString: Located in Morere area
Name: Ridge Track
Introduction: A demanding track suitable for fit walkers.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: A bridge on the track  leading through nikau palms. Photo: Moira Lee.

DogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.
LocationString: Located in Rimutaka Forest Park
Name: Rimutaka Rail Trail
Introduction: Built in 1878, this rail route between the Hutt Valley and Featherston is now a gently graded 18 km walk, run or mountain bike ride, with opportunities for camping, swimming and fishing.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Walkers and cyclist check out the Rimutaka Rail Trail interpretation.  Photo: Jason Kerehi/Greater Wellington Regional Council. Photo: Jason Kerehi/Greater Wellington Regional Council.

LocationString: Located in Fox Glacier area, Westland Tai Poutini National Park
Name: River Walk
Introduction: Enjoy this pleasant short walk and get a great view of the glacier and the opportunity to cross a historic suspension bridge.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: View from Fox River bridge.

LocationString: Located in Fox Glacier area, Westland Tai Poutini National Park
Name: River Walk Lookout Track
Introduction: Enjoy a short journey through the rainforest to a lookout to get a great view of Fox Glacier Te Moeka o Tuawe.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: View from River Walk Lookout. Photo: K Henderson.

LocationString: Located in Kahurangi National Park, Motueka area
Name: Riwaka Resurgence
Introduction: Walk to the cave and deep, clear pool where the Riwaka River emerges from the depths of the Takaka Hill.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Riwaka Resurgence. Photo: Chris Gin | CC BY-NC-ND 2.0.

LocationString: Located in Matukituki Valley area, Mount Aspiring National Park
Name: Rob Roy Track
Introduction: Rob Roy Valley is a good entry point to an area of spectacular alpine scenery, snowfields, glaciers, sheer rock cliffs and waterfalls.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Trampers on the Rob Roy Track PHOTO: Giovanni Variottinelli | Creative Commons

Alerts.Heading: Rob Roy Track - avalanche risk
Alerts.Detail:
Due to avalanche risk, do not go past the lower valley lookout on the Rob Roy Track.

Reviewed on 8 June 2016.

LocationString: Located in Franz Josef Glacier/K Roimata o Hine Hukatere, Westland Tai Poutini National Park
Name: Roberts Point Track
Introduction: The Roberts Point Track requires a good level of fitness.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: The spectacular new bridge on Roberts Point Track. Photo: DOC
Parks: Franz Josef Glacier/K Roimata o Hine Hukatere

LocationString: Located in Rock and Pillar Conservation Area
Name: Rock and Pillar tracks
Introduction: The Rock and Pillar Range, little more than an hour from Dunedin, is one of Otago's most distinctive upland features - its summit ridge dominated by impressive schist tors or rocky pillars.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Tors above Big Top Hut.

Alerts.Heading: Leaning Lodge Hut in the Rock and Pillar Conservation Area is unavailable for public use.
Alerts.Detail:
Contact the Otago Tramping and Mountaineering Club for further information otmc@ihug.co.nz.

This is a long term alert.

Distance: 10 km to hut, 3.5 km to bushline
WalkingTime: 6 hr to hut, then 4 - 5 hrs to bushline
LocationString: Located in Fiordland National Park, Lake Monowai/Borland Road area
Name: Rodger Inlet Track
Introduction: This difficult tramping track leads to a hut, then a route heads for the bushline at Lake Monowai, Fiordland.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Looking across Lake Monowai at Rodger Inlet Hut.

Alerts.Heading: Tree falls on Lake Monowai/Borland Tracks
Alerts.Detail:
Some tree falls are possible on all tracks in the Lake Monowai/Borland Road area.

Reviewed on 18 December 2015

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
LocationString: Located in Ruahine Forest Park
Name: Rokaiwhenua Stream Walk
Introduction: Rokaiwhenua Stream Walk is a pleasant and easy 1-hour forest walk you get to from Tamaki Road end in Eastern Ruahine Forest.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Northern rata in flower.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
LocationString: Located in Ross area
Name: Ross Historic Goldfields walks
Introduction: These walks in Ross township, 30 km south of Hokitika on SH6, start from the Ross Goldfields Information and Heritage Centre, where you can check track conditions.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Helihikes are popular on Mt Greenland.

DogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.
LocationString: Located in Taupo area
Name: Rotary Ride and Waikato River Track
Introduction: These two tracks along the banks of the Waikato River allow for stunning views of the river, and access to Huka Falls and the network of mountain bike trails in the area.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Riders stop for a break and to admire the Huka Falls. PHOTO: Destination Great Lake Taupo .

LocationString: Located in Lake Rotoiti and Lake Rotoma Scenic Reserves
Name: Rotoma Bridle Track
Introduction: Walk through a magnificant stand of native bush.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Rotoma Bridle Track.
Parks: Lake Rotoiti and Lake Rotoma Scenic Reserves

LocationString: Located in Tongariro National Park, Turangi area
Name: Rotopounamu Track
Introduction: This track circles a beautiful lake surrounded by native forest and is a special favourite of tree lovers, birdwatchers, and families.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: The still waters of the lake taken from Long Beach at the track's halfway point. Photo: Anna Elwarth.

LocationString: Located in Lewis Pass Scenic Reserve
Name: Rough Creek Track
Introduction: This track leads to Lake Christabel.

LocationString: Located in Tongariro National Park
Name: Round the Mountain Track
Introduction: The Round the Mountain Track showcases the varied volcanic landscapes and alpine vegetation on the flanks of the active volcano Mount Ruapehu.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Round the Mountain Track.

LocationString: Located in Mount Aspiring National Park
Name: Routeburn Nature Walk
Introduction: An easy going, well interpreted loop track ideal for a family walk.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Routeburn Nature Walk.

LocationString: Located in Fiordland National Park, Mount Aspiring National Park
Name: Routeburn Track
Introduction: This is the ultimate alpine adventure, weaving through meadows, reflective tarns and alpine gardens.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Lake Harris.

Alerts.Heading: Snow and ice
Alerts.Detail: Snow and ice is present on the track over Harris Saddle.

Alerts.Heading: Bridges removed
Alerts.Detail: Bridges are removed to avoid them being damaged by avalanches.  Those intending to walk the track need to be competent at crossing large, swift, icy rivers.

Alerts.Heading: Reduced facilities and additional safety hazards from 28 April - 24 October 2016
Alerts.Detail:
The Great Walks season has ended on the Routeburn Track.

From 28 April 2016 to 24 October 2016, facilities are greatly reduced and there are additional safety hazards to consider. Walking the track during this time should only be attempted by fit, experienced and well-equipped people. For more information see Walking the Routeburn Track outside the Great Walks season.

LocationString: Located in Fiordland National Park, Milford Road/Milford Sound area
Name: Routeburn Track: Earland Falls Track
Introduction: This is a fabulous, easy day walk on the Routeburn Track (a Great Walk), leading to the beautiful Earland Falls with plenty of mountain and valley views along the way.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Earland Falls, Routeburn Track. Photo copyright: Douglas Thorne. DOC USE ONLY.

LocationString: Located in Fiordland National Park, Milford Road/Milford Sound area
Name: Routeburn Track: Key Summit Track
Introduction: Enjoy panoramic views over Fiordland mountains and alpine lakes, and native vegetation and birdlife on this fantastic, easy half-day walk on the Routeburn Track from the Milford Road.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Walker on the Key Summit Track. Photo: Shellie Evans

LocationString: Located in Fiordland National Park, Milford Road/Milford Sound area
Name: Routeburn Track: Lake Howden Track
Introduction: This is an easy half-day walk on the Routeburn Track (Great Walk), leading to Lake Howden with plenty of mountain and valley views along the way.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Peaceful Lake Howden, Routeburn Track. Photo copyright: Alex Komarovsky. DOC USE ONLY.

LocationString: Located in Wanaka area
Name: Roys Peak Track
Introduction: Roys Peak Track is a walking track in the Wanaka Area.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: View from Roys Peak.

Alerts.Heading: Snow and ice on track
Alerts.Detail: Snow and ice are present on the upper section of Roys Peak. People intending to walk this track should be well equipped with winter alpine experience.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
LocationString: Located in Ruahine Forest Park
Name: Ruahine Corner to Rangitane Road
Introduction: An excellent but strenuous trip in the remote north western Ruahine Forest Park renowned for its scenery and ecological values.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Ruahine Corner to Colenso Hut.

Alerts.Heading: Maropea swing bridge closed
Alerts.Detail: Maropea swing bridge is currently closed due to failing an engineers inspection  do not cross the swing bridge as it has been deemed unsafe. Use the alternative bridges and tracks downstream closer to Iron Bark Hut.

Alerts.Heading: Colenso to Iron Bark Track Conditions
Alerts.Detail:
There is a large slip on the Colenso to Iron Bark track. Extreme caution is needed.

Reviewed on 27 June 2016

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only.
LocationString: Located in Waipu area
Name: Ruakaka Pipeline Road Track
Introduction: Ruakaka Pipeline Road Track is considered suitable for people of most fitness levels.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Bream Bay on a stormy day. Photo: Angelika Cawte.

Alerts.Heading: Ruakaka Pipeline Track closure
Alerts.Detail: Due to construction work the Ruakaka Pipeline Track is closed until further notice. Work is underway to provide 4WD vehicle beach access. The track should be open again soon.

LocationString: Located in Waitomo area
Name: Ruakuri Walk
Introduction: Discover a forested gorge, natural sculpted cliffs and low limestone arches on this spectacular loop walk.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Ruakuri Walk.

LocationString: Located in Pirongia Forest Park
Name: Ruapane Lookout
Introduction: Climb to a lookout on Mount Pirongia with excellent views across the Waikato Basin to the Kaimai Ranges.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Ruapane Lookout.

LocationString: Located in Lake Waikaremoana area, Te Urewera
Name: Ruapani Circuit Track
Introduction: It will take you six hours of moderate to hard walking to complete the Ruapani Circuit.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Sundews at Lake Ruapani, Ruapani Tarns. Photo: Paul Cashmore | DOC.

LocationString: Located in Ruapekapeka Historic Reserve
Name: Ruapekapeka Pa Track
Introduction: A 30-minute walk leads you to Ruapekapeka Pa, which is where the final battle of War of the North was waged.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: The waharoa at the entrance to Ruapekapeka Pa.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only.
LocationString: Located in Russell Forest and Ngaiotonga Scenic Reserve
Name: Russell Forest walks (Ngaiotonga to Russell Forest)

IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Trees at Ngaiotonga.

Alerts.Heading: Rahui (temporary closure) in place
Alerts.Detail:
Respect and avoid the Punaruku end of the track from Pukemoremore to the Punaruku car park to prevent further potential spread of kauri dieback.

This is a long term alert. Reviewed on 30 May 2016.

Parks: Russell Forest and Ngaiotonga Scenic Reserve

LocationString: Located in Tairua area
Name: Sailors Grave Whenuakite track
Introduction: Just north of Tairua, a track will take you down Lynch Stream to Otara Bay.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Sailors Grave Historic Reserve. Photo: Russell Street | CC BY-SA 2.0.

LocationString: Located in Whirinaki Te Pua-a-Tne Conservation Park
Name: Sanctuary Track
Introduction: The Sanctuary Track in Whirinaki Te Pua-a-Tne Conservation Park is an easy loop track that leads through remnant podocarp forest.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: The Whirinaki River near the Sanctuary Track.

LocationString: Located in Dunedin area, Otago Peninsula area
Name: Sandfly Bay Track
Introduction: Walk to Sandfly Bay and combine coastal views with wildlife viewing.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Sandfly Bay.

LocationString: Located in Dunedin area, Otago Peninsula area
Name: Sandymount Track

IntroductionThumbnailAltText: View of Cape Saunders from Sandymount

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
LocationString: Located in Isolated Hill Scenic Reserve
Name: Sawcut Gorge/Isolated Hill Route

IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Sawcut Gorge PHOTO: Shellie Evans .

LocationString: Located in Hwea Conservation Park

IntroductionThumbnailAltText: View from Sawyer Burn Track. Photo: Chrissy Wickes.

LocationString: Located in Glenorchy area
Name: Scott Creek Track
Introduction: This route to a bush-line musterers' hut is for experienced trampers.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Scott Creek Track.

LocationString: Located in Mount Hutt area
Name: Scotts Saddle Track
Introduction: Starting in Mt Hutt Forest and ending at Mount Hutt Skifield Road, Scotts Saddle Track offers beautiful views over mid-Canterbury.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: View from Scotts Saddle. Photo: G Iles.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
LocationString: Located in Pureora Forest Park
Name: Select Loop Road
Introduction: A gentle ride through beautiful forest on formed 2WD metalled roads.

LocationString: Located in Kaimai Mamaku Forest Park
Name: Sentinel Rock Lookout Track
Introduction: A challenging climb to an isolated rock outcrop in the Kaimai Ranges that offers spectacular views across the valley.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: View of  Sentinel Rock from the track.

LocationString: Located in Franz Josef Glacier/K Roimata o Hine Hukatere, Westland Tai Poutini National Park

LocationString: Located in Queenstown area

Introduction: This is a 4WDonly road that takes you through Tarndale to the Acheron Road.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Sedgemere Road.

LocationString: Located in Hakatere Conservation Park, Mount Somers area
Name: Sharplin Falls Track
Introduction: Enjoy a short, scenic walk to a waterfall.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Sharplin Falls.

Alerts.Heading: Sharplin Falls Track closed
Alerts.Detail:
The Sharplin Falls Track has been closed since February 2015 due to a rock fall which destroyed part of the gantry structure. Due to this damage and the ongoing rock fall hazard the track remains closed. 

Reviewed on 29 June 2016

LocationString: Located in Kingston area
Name: Shirt Tail Track
Introduction: A track climbing through beech forest following the Shirt Tail Stream in Kingston.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: View from Shirt Tail Track. Photo: Eiji Kitai.

LocationString: Located in Matukituki Valley area, Mount Aspiring National Park
Name: Shotover Saddle Route
Introduction: The Shotover Saddle Route offers magnificent views of the West Matukituki and Rob Roy valleys.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: View over the Matukituki Valley. Image:  Image: Tomas Sobek | Creative Commons

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only.
LocationString: Located in Hokianga Heads area
Name: Signal Station Track
Introduction: This short track takes you out to the historic Signal Station Point on the south head of the Hokianga Harbour.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: View from Signal Station Track.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
LocationString: Located in Silver Peaks Scenic Reserve
Name: Silver Peaks routes
Introduction: The Silver Peaks Scenic Reserve provides challenging routes in rugged country, less than 30 minutes drive from Dunedin city.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Silver Peaks Track. Photo: Daniel Jack.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only.
LocationString: Located in Waima Forest
Name: Six Foot Track
Introduction: This is an easy walk to Framptons Hut and on to the Waima Main Range Track.

LocationString: Located in Skippers area
Name: Skippers area short walks
Introduction: There are a number of short walks in the Skippers area, providing an insight to the early pioneer mining era.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: kippers Point Cemetery. Photo: Anna Humphries.

Alerts.Heading: Branches falling from dead trees during high winds
Alerts.Detail:
During high winds small-sized branches are falling out of dead trees within the densely forested pine stands in Mount Aurum Recreation Reserve. Avoid areas of dead trees during high winds.

Reviewed 27 June 2016

LocationString: Located in Wanaka area
Name: Skyline Track
Introduction: The Skyline Track is a tramping track in the Wanaka area.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: The Skyline Route from Wanaka township.

DogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.
LocationString: Located in Tararua Forest Park
Name: Smith Creek - Tauherenikau River
Introduction: This is a daytrip in the southern Tararua Range and the exit/entry to the Kaitoke-Holdsworth Tramp.

LocationString: Located in Bream Head Scenic Reserve, Whangarei Heads area
Name: Smugglers Bay Loop Track
Introduction: Located in the Bream Head Scenic Reserve, this easy 3-km loop track takes you around from Busby Head to Smugglers Bay.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Smuggler's Bay Walkway. Photo: Florian Bugiel | CC BY-SA 2.0.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
LocationString: Located in Snowdon Forest Conservation Area
Name: Snowdon Forest tramping tracks
Introduction: Snowdon Forest tramping tracks are used infrequently and many are marked routes only.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Red tussock, Kiwi Burn Walk. Photo: Shellie Evans

LocationString: Located in Ahuriri Conservation Park, Ruataniwha Conservation Park
Name: Snowy Gorge Creek - Maitland Stream
Introduction: This unmarked route is for experienced trampers and travels through diverse country.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Snowy Gorge Creek with Snowy Gorge Hut (foreground).

LocationString: Located in Fiordland National Park, Lake Monowai/Borland Road area
Name: South Borland Track
Introduction: This short tramping track goes between Borland Lodge and 6km along the Borland Road, Monowai, Fiordland.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: South Borland Track.

Alerts.Heading: Tree falls on Lake Monowai/Borland Tracks
Alerts.Detail:
Some tree falls are possible on all tracks in the Lake Monowai/Borland Road area.

Reviewed on 18 December 2015

WalkingTime: 7 hr to Port Craig, 4 days to Big River
LocationString: Located in Fiordland National Park, Tuatapere area

Introduction: This track of varying difficulty leads along rugged southern Fiordland coast to Port Craig (easy overnight) and beyond to the more remote Big River (4 days one way).
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Percy Burn Viaduct, on the South Coast Track.

LocationString: Located in Mavora Lakes Conservation Park
Name: South Mavora Lake walking tracks
Introduction: Looking for day walks from the Mavora Lakes camping ground in the Te Anau area? Try the South Mavora Lake Walking Track or the track to the Kiwiburn Hut.

LocationString: Located in Peel Forest Park Scenic Reserve
Name: South Ridge Route, Peel Forest Park
Introduction: The South Ridge Route, a steep descent off little Mt Peel, should be made by experienced trampers or climbers.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Kahikatea, Peel Forest.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
LocationString: Located in Kaimanawa Forest Park
Name: Southern Access Corridor
Introduction: This route, bordering Defence Force land, heads from the Desert Road through to the Otamateanui Stream and Rangitikei River confluence.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: The Rangitikei River. PHOTO: Ian Mcknickle, DOC.

WalkingTime: 4 - 6 days round trip from Freshwater landing
LocationString: Located in Rakiura National Park, Stewart Island/Rakiura
Name: Southern Circuit Stewart Island/Rakiura
Introduction: Stewart Island/Rakiura's Southern Circuit Track is a remote, challenging tramp and requires good fitness and route-finding skills.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Looking towards Mt. Rakeahua and Mason Bay. Photo: Jake Osborne | CC BY-NC-SA 2.0.

LocationString: Located in Nelson Lakes National Park
Name: Speargrass Track
Introduction: For an easy overnight tramp, walk to Speargrass Hut on this well graded track.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Speargrass Hut.

LocationString: Located in Coromandel Forest Park
Name: Square Kauri Tree
Introduction: Climb a short track to marvel at an unusual square trunked kauri and enjoy the view across to Maumaupaki on the main Coromandel Range.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: The square kauri tree. Photo: Peter Dutton | CC BY-NC-SA 2.0.

LocationString: Located in Nelson Lakes National Park
Name: St Arnaud Range Track
Introduction: Climb onto the St Arnaud Range for spectacular views of the surrounding area.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Lake Rotoiti from Parachute Rocks.

LocationString: Located in St James Conservation Area
Name: St James - Waiau Pass Track
Introduction: Waiau Pass Track follows the true right of the Waiau River, St James Conservation Area.

LocationString: Located in St James Conservation Area
Name: St James Cycle Trail
Introduction: This trail offers challenging, mixed riding through stunning scenery of mountain peaks, crystal clear waters, high country lakes, alpine meadows, subalpine beech forest, and expansive grassy flats.

LocationString: Located in Lewis Pass Scenic Reserve, St James Conservation Area
Name: St James Walkway
Introduction: This track passes through pastoral land, beech forest and sub-alpine regions, and is a great introduction to multi-night tramping.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Magdalen Valley, viewed from the St James Walkway. Photo: Timothy Musson | CC BY-NC-SA 2.0.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only.
LocationString: Located in Whangaroa area

Introduction: This track leads to St Paul's Rock, which stands high above Whangaroa township and provides spectacular views of the Whangaroa Harbour.

LocationString: Located in Jackson Bay - Gorge River area
Name: Stafford Bay Route
Introduction: Stafford Bay is approximately 50 km south of the Haast Junction near the Jackson Bay Okahu wharf.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Kakapo Creek. Photo: K Henderson.

Alerts.Heading: Smoothwater Track closed
Alerts.Detail:
Smoothwater Track is currently closed after several slips have taken out large chunks of the track. It is dangerous for trampers to go around the slips due to the steepness of the terrain.

Reviewed on 12 May 2016.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
LocationString: Located in Ruahine Forest Park
Name: Stanfield Hut Route
Introduction: This is an unmarked riverbed route to Stanfield Hut from Tamaki Road end in Eastern Ruahine Forest Park.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Stanfield Hut.

LocationString: Located in St James Conservation Area
Name: Stanley River Route
Introduction: This marked route links Charlies Saddle to Stanley Vale Hut in the St James Conservation Area.

LocationString: Located in Fiordland National Park, Lake Manapouri area
Name: Stockyard Cove Track
Introduction: This is a pleasant, short walking track in Hope Arm on Lake Manapouri, leading to either West Beach or the waterfalls above the cove.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Stockyard Cove Track, great for families.

LocationString: Located in Stony Batter Historic Reserve, Waiheke Island
Name: Stony Batter Historic Reserve walks
Introduction: DOC manages a number of short walks starting from the Stony Batter Historic Reserve.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Stony Batter Historic Reserve. Photo: Cristel Veefkind | CC BY-NC-ND 2.0.

Alerts.Heading: Stony Batter Historic Reserve - tunnels closed
Alerts.Detail:
The historic tunnels at Stony Batter Reserve are currently closed for health and safety reasons.

DOC is in the process of selecting a new operator to provide a high quality visitor experience at the site. It is anticipated that a new concession application will be lodged early 2016, and the new operator will be up and running by the summer of 201617.

This alert is valid long term.

LocationString: Located in Hunters Hills area
Name: Studholme Bush Scenic Reserve tracks
Introduction: Enjoy a wide range of tracks, from an easy, fun cycle with the family along Railway Track, to a steep 50-minute walk to the Whitehorse monument with great views out over Waimate.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Mountain biker on Mt Studholme.

LocationString: Located in Mount Aspiring National Park
Name: Sugarloaf/Rockburn Track
Introduction: This marked track traverses moraine through beech forest from Lake Sylvan.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: The view from Sugarloaf. Photo: DOC.

LocationString: Located in Ruahine Forest Park
Name: Sunrise Track
Introduction: The track to Sunrise Hut is one of the most popular walks in Eastern Ruahine Forest Park and is well suited to family and school groups.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Sunrise Track. Photo: Wei-Hang Chua (CC BY-NC-ND 2.0).

LocationString: Located in Sutton Salt Lake Scenic Reserve
Name: Sutton Salt Lake walk
Introduction: Take a self-guided loop walk around Sutton Salt Lake, New Zealand's only inland salt lake.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Sutton Salt Lake.

LocationString: Located in Cobb Valley, Kahurangi National Park
Name: Sylvester Hut Track
Introduction: Discover a number of lakes on the open tops behind Sylvester Hut.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
LocationString: Located in Ruahine Forest Park
Name: Table Flat - Kashmir Roadend West-East crossing
Introduction: A west east traverse of the Ruahine Forest Park, following the Oroua River valley and over the main Ruahine Range to the Kashmir Roadend.

LocationString: Located in Kahurangi National Park, Mount Arthur area
Name: Tableland Circuit
Introduction: Rock shelters, an open tussock plateau and tops with superb views, combine to make this an interesting introductory tramp.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Tablelands and Arthur Range.

LocationString: Located in Whangarei area
Name: Taheke Waterfall Track
Introduction: This lovely 3-km loop track leads through a grove of regenerating kauri and offers views of the Taheke Waterfall.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Taheke waterfall.

Alerts.Heading: Taheke Waterfall Track closure
Alerts.Detail:
The Taheke Waterfall Track is being upgraded in response to Kauri dieback disease and will be closed until further notice.

Work will take place during June and July and it is hoped that the track will be re-open after that.

Kauri dieback disease is killing our native kauri. It spreads by soil movement, but you can help prevent it.

DogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.
LocationString: Located in Taupo area
Name: Tahunatara Point Walk
Introduction: An easy walk, ideal for families, in beautiful Whakaipo Bay.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Whakaipo Bay.

LocationString: Located in Dunedin area, Waihola - Taieri Mouth area
Name: Taieri River Track
Introduction: An interesting walk in the Taieri Gorge that travels alongside the Taieri River and passes through several different types of vegetation.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Start of Taieri River Track.

LocationString: Located in Kelly Range - Styx River area
Name: Taipo River Track to Harman Pass
Introduction: The Taipo Valley is often travelled as part of a popular route from the Waimakariri River via Harman Pass.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only.
LocationString: Located in Waima Forest
Name: Taita Bridle Track
Introduction: This moderately challenging track leads into the beautiful and rugged Waima Forest.

LocationString: Located in Takaka area
Name: Takaka short walks
Introduction: Te Waikoropup Springs, Milnthorpe Park and Grove Scenic Reserve are all a short drive from Takaka and have good opportunities for short walks.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Te Waikoropup Springs walkway.

Distance: 11 km to A-Frame Hut, further 6 km to road-end
DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
LocationString: Located in Ruahine Forest Park
Name: Takapari Road
Introduction: This advanced mountain bike track climbs for 16 km to the top of the Ruahine Range and offers great views on a clear day to the coast on both sides of the North Island.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Mountain bike trip to Takapari Road. Photo by Raewyn Knight.

LocationString: Located in Takitimu Conservation Area
Name: Takitimu Mountains routes
Introduction: Challenging routes traverse the forest area of Takitimu Mountains taking you to Aparima Forks Hut or Spence Hut.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Takitimu Mountains, Southland.

LocationString: Located in Takitimu Conservation Area
Name: Takitimu Mountains tramping tracks
Introduction: Tramping tracks in the Takitimu Mountains take you thorugh attractive open beech forest, tussock and screes.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Tussock, Redcliff Creek, Takitimu Mountains, Southland. Photo: Karl Blaas.

LocationString: Located in Geraldine area
Name: Talbot Forest Scenic Reserve tracks
Introduction: These short walks in and around Talbot Forest Scenic Reserve are ideal for families.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Kahikatea Track.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only.
LocationString: Located in Waipoua Forest
Name: Tane Mahuta Walk
Introduction: Visit Tane Mahuta in the Waipoua Forest, New Zealand's largest known living kauri tree.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Tane Mahuta. Photo: Russell Street | CC BY-SA 2.0.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only.
LocationString: Located in Tangihua Forest
Name: Tangihua Forest Nature Walk
Introduction: This nature walk winds through native forest and takes just over an hour one way.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Fungi growing on a tree.

Alerts.Heading: Tangihua Forest Nature Walk closure
Alerts.Detail:
The Tangihua Forest Nature Walk is being upgraded in response to Kauri dieback disease and will be closed until further notice.

Work will take place during June and July and it is hoped that the track will be re-open after that.

Kauri dieback disease is killing our native kauri. It spreads by soil movement, but you can help prevent it.

LocationString: Located in Tutira area
Name: Tangoio Falls Scenic Reserve tracks
Introduction: Walk to Te Ana or Tangoio Falls or take a longer walk through native bush on the Tangoio Walkway.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Te Ana Falls.

LocationString: Located in Russell area
Name: Tapeka Point Track
Introduction: This easy track is just 1 km north of Maiki/Flagstaff Hill, near Russell.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Tapeka Point and track.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only.
LocationString: Located in Te Paki Recreation Reserve, Cape Reinga (Te Rerenga Wairua)
Name: Tapotupotu Bay to Cape Reinga/Te Rerenga Wairua
Introduction: Starting at Tapotupotu Bay, this 5 km track climbs steeply for incredible views before descending into Sandy Bay and on to the Cape Reinga lighthouse.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Walkers at Tapotupotu Bay.

DogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.
LocationString: Located in Tararua Forest Park
Name: Tararua Northern Crossing
Introduction: The Northern Crossing links the Ohau and Waingawa catchments in Tararua Forest Park and is one of four classic tramps in the park.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Trampers approaching the summit of Mitre on the Northern Crossing. Photo: Jeremy Rolfe.

DogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.
LocationString: Located in Tararua Forest Park
Name: Tararua Southern Crossing
Introduction: The Southern Crossing is one of the four classic tramps of the Tararua Range.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Tararua Southern Crossing.

Alerts.Heading: Otaki Gorge Road closed
Alerts.Detail:
Otaki Gorge Road is closed due a slip. Do not attempt to walk across the slip. The slip is unstable with potential rock falls.

The best access to Otaki Forks is via the Otaki Forks emergency access track, starting from Shields Flat Historic Reserve carpark.

Alternative campsites are Catchpool Valley and Holdsworth.

Work to restore road access will start towards the end of March 2016. It is expected to be completed and the road reopened some time after July 2016. More on the Kapiti Coast District Council website.

This alert is valid long term. Reviewed 6 July 2016.

LocationString: Located in Lake Tarawera Scenic Reserve
Name: Tarawera Falls Track
Introduction: The track runs between the Waterfall road carpark to the spectacular falls, where water surges out of fissures in a high cliff face.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Tarawera Falls.

LocationString: Located in Lake Tarawera Scenic Reserve
Name: Tarawera Outlet to Falls Track
Introduction: See the Tarawera River disappearing underground at various sites before it re-emerges through the spectacular Tarawera Falls through narrow fissures in a fractured rhyolite lava cliff.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Tarawera Falls.

Alerts.Heading: Caution required
Alerts.Detail:
There is structural damage on the Tarawera Outlet to Falls Track. The track has been re-routed to allow access to and from the falls however caution is required.

Reviewed on 30 June 2016

LocationString: Located in Lake Tarawera Scenic Reserve
Name: Tarawera Outlet to Humphries Bay
Introduction: This area was extensively altered by the 1886 Tarawera eruption and the landscape is being slowly regenerated by native plant species.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Bridge at Tarawera Outlet.

LocationString: Located in Lake Tarawera Scenic Reserve
Name: Tarawera Trail
Introduction: Meander your way through bush from Te Waiora to Hot Water Beach Campsite.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Views of Lake Tarawera.

Alerts.Heading: Rock fall on Tarawera Trail
Alerts.Detail: We have been alerted to rock fall in parts of the Tarawera Trail past Te Wairua Amenity Area. Although this rock fall is minimal, there is evidence of cracking and loose rock in the cliff face. A geo-technical engineer his being organised to assess the area. Due caution is advised

LocationString: Located in Puketeraki Forest Conservation Area
Name: Tarn Hut Track
Introduction: A remote subalpine track from Youngman Stream to Tarn Hut.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Lees Valley, from the tops between Lilburn Hill and Tarn Hut. Port Hills can be made out in the distance far left. Image: Harley James

LocationString: Located in Kerikeri area
Name: Taronui Bay Recreation Reserve Track
Introduction: Walking the track will take you through a mixed landscape of pasture and wooded areas to the beautiful white sands of Taronui Bay.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Taronui Bay.

LocationString: Located in Lake Pukaki area
Name: Tasman River tracks
Introduction: Tasman River is a large braided river which flows into Lake Pukaki.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Mountain biker on the Tasman River Trail.

LocationString: Located in Aoraki/Mount Cook National Park

LocationString: Located in Franz Josef Glacier/K Roimata o Hine Hukatere, Westland Tai Poutini National Park

Parks: Franz Josef Glacier/K Roimata o Hine Hukatere

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only.
LocationString: Located in Mangonui area
Name: Taumarumaru Scenic Reserve Walk
Introduction: Taumarumaru Scenic Reserve is mostly an open area and tracks are identified by mowing and track markers.

LocationString: Located in Waioeka Gorge Scenic Reserve

DogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.
LocationString: Located in Tongariro Forest Conservation Area
Name: Taurewa Track

IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Taurewa Track boardwalk Image: Fanny Leduc | Creative Commons

LocationString: Located in Catlins coastal area
Name: Tautuku walks

LocationString: Located in Catchpool Valley & Orongorongo Valley, Rimutaka Forest Park
Name: Tawa Grove Walk

LocationString: Located in Tawarau Conservation Area
Name: Tawarau Forest tramping tracks
Introduction: The limestone features and native vegetation in the Tawarau Forest can best be seen by walking on one of the forest's scenic tracks.

LocationString: Located in Franz Josef Glacier/K Roimata o Hine Hukatere, Westland Tai Poutini National Park
Name: Te Ara a Waiau Walkway/Cycleway

LocationString: Located in Manawatu Gorge Scenic Reserve
Name: Te Ara o Mahurangi mountain biking track
Introduction: Part of the Te Apiti  Manawatu Gorge network of tracks, Te Ara o Mahurangi is an exciting downhill mountain bike trail.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Manawatu Mountain Bike Club rider on the trail at the opening event.

LocationString: Located in Banks Peninsula area
Name: Te Ara Ptaka
Introduction: Enjoy magnificent views over Banks Peninsula, the Canterbury plains, Southern Alps and Pacific ocean on this track (previously known as the Summit Walkway) which is about an hour's drive from Christchurch.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Views from Te Ara Ptaka.

LocationString: Located in Pukaha Mount Bruce Wildlife Centre
Name: Te Arapiki o Tawhaki
Introduction: Experience stunning views and native bush on Te Arapiki o Tawhaki at Pukaha Mount Bruce.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: View from the lookout. Photo: Sue Galbraith.

LocationString: Located in Waikanae area
Name: Te Au Track
Introduction: The track climbs to 521 m and offers panoramic views of the Waikanae Estuary and Kapiti Island.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Olearia paniculata or akiraho can be seen on the Te Au Track. Photo: Jeremy Rolfe.

LocationString: Located in Turangi area
Name: Te Hapua Bay Track
Introduction: Located on the western shore of Lake Taupo, this track allows walking access to one of the most stunning bays on the lake.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Te Hapua Bay on the western shores of Lake Taupo.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only.
WalkingTime: 3 hr 45 min to junction one way from car park
LocationString: Located in Tangihua Forest
Name: Te Haua Uru Track
Introduction: The Te Haua Uru Track is located in the Tangihua Forest and links with the Horokaka Track and Tangihua Main Ridge Track to form a loop that will take experienced trampers 9 hours to complete.

LocationString: Located in Muriwai and Te Henga area

IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Stunning views from Te Henga Walkway. Photo: Martin Sercombe | CC BY-NC-ND 2.0.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
LocationString: Located in Kaimanawa Forest Park
Name: Te Iringa Track
Introduction: On this challenging and remote adventure ride, pass through beech forest and enjoy the scenery, streams and wildlife of the Kaimanawa Forest Park.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Te Iringa track.

LocationString: Located in Te Kauri Park Scenic Reserve
Name: Te Kauri Park Circuit Walk
Introduction: Walk alongside the attractive Waikuku Stream then climb up to good views of the surrounding countryside.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Waikuku Stream, Oparau. Photo: J. L Kendrick.

LocationString: Located in Kingston area
Name: Te Kere Haka Track
Introduction: The Te Kere Haka Track follows the shore of Lake Wakatipu.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Te Kere Haka Track. Photo: Eiji Kitai.

LocationString: Located in Gisborne area
Name: Te Kuri Farm Walkway
Introduction: Enjoy panoramic views from various points on this track, as well as from a lookout point at the top (290 m).
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Te Kuri Farm Walkway.

LocationString: Located in Whanganui National Park
Name: Te Maire Loop Track
Introduction: This is a fine example of the podocarp forest which once covered much of the central North Island.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Suspension bridge at the entrance to the Te Maire Loop Track.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only.
LocationString: Located in Waipoua Forest
Name: Te Matua Ngahere Walk
Introduction: Take a 20-minute walk in Waipoua Forest to view the worlds second largest living kauri 'Te Matua Ngahere'.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Te Matua Ngahere.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only.
LocationString: Located in Te Paki Recreation Reserve, Cape Reinga (Te Rerenga Wairua)
Name: Te Paki Coastal Track
Introduction: This scenic track follows the rugged coastline of Cape Reinga and descends to Te Werahi and Twilight beaches.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: The track finishes at Te Paki Stream PHOTO: Pierre Roudier | Creative Commons

LocationString: Located in Te Reinga Scenic Reserve
Name: Te Reinga Scenic Reserve Walk
Introduction: This short track takes you to lookout with views of the spectacular Te Reinga Falls.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Te Reinga Falls. Photo: Jamie Quirk.

LocationString: Located in Kaimai Mamaku Forest Park
Name: Te Rereatukahia Loop Track
Introduction: Grass clearings and an old fence are a legacy of days gone by when this section was highly modified by burning and farming.

LocationString: Located in Te Tapui Scenic Reserve
Name: Te Tapui Loop Track
Introduction: A loop track follows through the bush and up to the summit, with a lookout tower and great views across to the Kaimai Ranges and Firth of Thames.

LocationString: Located in Whakarewarewa State Forest Park
Name: Te Tihi o Tawa Trail
Introduction: Te Tihi o Tawa is a specifically built trail through native bush with great downhills for mountain bikers.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
LocationString: Located in Waioeka Conservation Area
Name: Te U Route
Introduction: Te U Route travels from the Waiotahi Valley Road end to Te U Bivvy (staff accommodation) in the Waioeka Conservation Area.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
LocationString: Located in Urutawa Conservation Area
Name: Te Waiti Hut Walk
Introduction: This track affords views of Te Waiti Stream and lowland forest and is suitable for a family day trip.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
LocationString: Located in Urutawa Conservation Area
Name: Te Waiti Nature Trail
Introduction: An ideal family walk through nikau and tawa forest.

LocationString: Located in Fox Glacier area, Westland Tai Poutini National Park
Name: Te Weheka Walkway/Cycleway
Introduction: Walk or cycle through bush from Fox Glacier township to the Fox Glacier car park.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Cyclist on Te Weheka.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only.
LocationString: Located in Te Paki Recreation Reserve, Cape Reinga (Te Rerenga Wairua)
Name: Te Werahi Beach to Twilight Beach
Introduction: Experience gorgeous peach-coloured dunes, unusual dune grasses, and views of Cape Maria van Diemen and Motuopao Island on this 3-hour track to Twilight Beach.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Views of Te Werahi Beach, Cape Maria van Diemen and Motuopao Island.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only.
LocationString: Located in Te Paki Recreation Reserve, Cape Reinga (Te Rerenga Wairua)
Name: Te Werahi Beach Track
Introduction: From Cape Reinga/Te Rerenga Wairua, this 2 km track follows the West Coast leading you down past steep cliffs to the long, sweeping Te Werahi Beach.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Overlooking Te Werahi Beach and Cape Maria van Dieman from Cape Reinga.

LocationString: Located in Bream Head Scenic Reserve, Whangarei Heads area
Name: Te Whara Track
Introduction: Follow an ancient Maori trail from Urquharts Bay to Ocean Beach.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Ocean Beach, Whangarei. Photo: Russell Street | CC BY-SA 2.0.

LocationString: Located in Fiordland National Park, Tuatapere area
Name: Teal Bay to Lake Poteriteri Hut Route
Introduction: This challenging tramping route travels through remote southern Fiordland forested valleys between Lake Hauroko and Lake Poteriteri.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Lake Poteriteri Hut.

LocationString: Located in Fiordland National Park, Tuatapere area
Name: Teal Bay to South Coast Track
Introduction: This difficult tramping track heads from the southern shore of Lake Hauroko, over alpine tops on Hump Ridge and down to the coast at Te Waewae Bay.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: On the Teal Bay Track.

DogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.
Name: Teetotal mountain bike tracks
Introduction: The Teetotal mountain biking tracks offer a challenging variety of length and difficulty for all users.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Teetotal Trail.

LocationString: Located in Ruataniwha Conservation Park
Name: Temple valley tracks
Introduction: These short tramping tracks travel through mountain beech forest.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: North Temple valley cirque. Photo: Mark Frost

LocationString: Located in Tenehaun Conservation Area
Name: Tenehaun Conservation Area tramping tracks
Introduction: The Tenehaun Conservation Area includes walks in the Moorhouse Range and Rangitata Gorge.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Tenehaun Conservation Area. Photo: G Iles.

LocationString: Located in Franz Josef Glacier/K Roimata o Hine Hukatere, Westland Tai Poutini National Park
Name: Terrace Walk
Introduction: Follow the Terrace Walk as it winds through forest and goes by remnants of past goldmining operations.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Terrace Walk.
Parks: Franz Josef Glacier/K Roimata o Hine Hukatere

LocationString: Located in Fiordland National Park, Milford Road/Milford Sound area
Name: The Chasm Walk
Introduction: Enjoy dramatic views of powerful waterfalls and water-sculpted shapes in the rocks on this easy access walk.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: The Chasm walkway offers dramatic river scenes. Photo: Mihoko Wada.

LocationString: Located in Lyell area, Mokihinui River area
Name: The Old Ghost Road
Introduction: This old gold miners' road is being revived as a tramping and mountain biking track.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Enjoying a break on the Old Ghost Road.

Distance: Full trail: 85 km, sections: from 5 to 45 km
DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
LocationString: Located in Pureora Forest Park
Name: The Timber Trail: Pureora - Ongarue
Introduction: Using historic bush tramways, old bulldozer and haul roads, and newly constructed track, this Grade 2/3 trail features 35 bridges, including some of the highest and longest in New Zealand.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Biker on a long, high, suspension bridge above native forest.

Alerts.Heading: Logging along the Timber Trail
Alerts.Detail: Cyclists may encounter logging trucks and other forestry vehicles on the Timber Trail between markers 75 - 79 from 1 June to 31 August.

LocationString: Located in Waioeka Gorge Scenic Reserve
Name: The Waioeka Journey - Te Awa a Tamatea
Introduction: Discover the stories of the Waioeka Gorge through a set of historical interpretation points at rest stops along the highway between Opotiki and Gisborne.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Couple with child looking at Waioeka Journey panel. Photo: Jill Hudson.

LocationString: Located in Arthur's Pass National Park
Name: Three Passes Route
Introduction: This classic summer tramp for experienced backcountry trampers crosses Harman Pass, Whitehorn Pass and Browning Pass/Noti Raureka.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: View at Browning Pass.

Alerts.Heading: Heavy snow and ice in all alpine terrains
Alerts.Detail: Very heavy snow and ice on all tracks / routes above the bushline. Do not attempt to access these areas without alpine / avalanche awareness and skills. Iceaxe and crampons are essential.

Alerts.Heading: Snow conditions on Whitehorn Pass
Alerts.Detail: Snow conditions exist on Whitehorn Pass - an iceaxe and crampons are required.

Alerts.Heading: Styx Valley Track rough
Alerts.Detail:
The Styx Valley Track is very rough with numerous slips to be negotiated. Approximately 20 minutes from the Styx car park the river has cut into a vertical cliff. To continue up the valley be prepared to cross the river below and above this cutting. If the river is high, or if parties are not confident with river crossings, use the Arahura Valley Track instead.

Reviewed on 28 June 2016

LocationString: Located in Lake Tikitapu Scenic Reserve
Name: Tikitapu Nature Walk
Introduction: The Tikitapu Nature Walk provides an opportunity to learn about the local flora and fauna through information panels along the track.

LocationString: Located in Hwea Conservation Park
Name: Timaru River Track
Introduction: From Lake Hwea the track follows the Timaru River, crosses Mount Martha Saddle and descends into the Ahuriri Valley.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Timaru River Track. Photo: D Grieve.

LocationString: Located in Tiritiri Matangi Scientific Reserve (Open Sanctuary)
Name: Tiritiri Matangi Island walks
Introduction: See a variety of native birds on the walks on this pest-free island, as well as views of the surrounding islands.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Grassy path, Tiritiri Matangi Island. Photo: Kai Lehnberg | CC BY-NC-ND 2.0.

LocationString: Located in Dunedin area, Waihola - Taieri Mouth area
Name: Titri Creek Track
Introduction: See hundreds of wading birds on this family-friendly short walk into the Titri wetands.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Titri Creek Track.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
LocationString: Located in Kokatahi River - Whitcombe River area
Name: Toaroha, Hokitika, Lower Whitcombe Track
Introduction: This route traverses rugged river valleys and crosses two alpine saddles.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Toaroha Swingbridge, Hokitika.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
LocationString: Located in Kokatahi River - Whitcombe River area
Name: Toaroha/Zit Saddle/Kokatahi/Lathrop Saddle/Styx River  Route
Introduction: This route traverses alpine ridges and crosses two alpine saddles.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Cedar Flat.

DogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only.
LocationString: Located in Waipoua Forest
Name: Toatoa Walk
Introduction: You can see fine examples of toatoa (blue celery pine) and other podocarps on this short walk in Waipoua Forest.
IntroductionThumbnailAltText: Ferns growing on a log. Photo: Angelika Cawte.

LocationString: Located in Mimiwhangata Coastal Park

Alerts.Heading: Reduced facilities and additional safety hazards from 1 May - 20 October 2016
Alerts.Detail:
The Great Walks season has ended on the Tongariro Northern Circuit.

From 1 May 2016 to 20 October 2016, facilities are greatly reduced and there are additional safety hazards to consider. Walking the track during this time should only be attempted by fit, experienced and well-equipped people. For more information see Walking the Tongariro Northern Circuit outside the Great Walks season.

Alerts.Heading: Rotoroa Route storm damage
Alerts.Detail:
There is severe damage on the Rotoroa Route alongside the eastern side of Lake Rotoroa between Rotoroa Village and Sabine Hut. This route is impassable and should not be attempted.

This damage will not affect trampers on the Travers-Sabine Circuit unless they were planning to end their trip at Rotoroa village.

This is a long term alert. Reviewed 29 June 2016.

Alerts.Heading: Rabbit control operations
Alerts.Detail:
Rabbit control operations using Pinedon poison will take place from 15 July 2016 in the following areas: 

  • Albert Town Conservation Area
  • Hawea River Marginal Strip
  • Butterfields Wildlife Management Area
  • Clutha River Conservation Area/Marginal strip
  • Scenic Reserve/Covenant Area
  • The Nook Scenic Reserve
  • Contact Scenic Reserve
  • Lower Lindis Conservation Area
  • Mata-Au Scientific Reserve.

Warning signs will be removed when the areas are declared non toxic (13 months after the bait has been laid).

If you see a warning sign about the pesticide Pindone:

  • do not touch pellets
  • watch Children at all times
  • do not eat animals from this area or from within a 2 km "buffer zone" outside the operational boundary.

Only when the warning signs have been removed is the all clear given and normal activities in the area can occur.

For further information contact Patrik Eschenmoser: peschenmoser@doc.govt.nz.

Alerts.Heading: Otaki Gorge Road closed
Alerts.Detail:
Otaki Gorge Road is closed due a slip. Do not attempt to walk across the slip. The slip is unstable with potential rock falls.

The best access to Otaki Forks is via the Otaki Forks emergency access track, starting from Shields Flat Historic Reserve carpark.

Alternative campsites are Catchpool Valley and Holdsworth.

Work to restore road access will start towards the end of March 2016. It is expected to be completed and the road reopened some time after July 2016. More on the Kapiti Coast District Council website.

This alert is valid long term. Reviewed 6 July 2016.

The road is expected to remain closed until December 2016. During this time the Prohibition Mine and Ball Mill cannot be accessed due to a mine remediation that is taking place.

This is a long term alert.

Alerts.Heading: Caution on Dart River ford - access to the Wangapeka and Mt Owen
Alerts.Detail:
The Dart River ford has filled up with silt and small rocks and the river is flowing over the ford, even at low water levels. Given the amount of silt upstream of the ford, Tasman District Council have advised they can no longer keep this ford free from gravel migration .

Drivers need to be cautious and assess the flow before driving across the ford.

This is a long term alert.

Alerts.Heading: Slips affecting Wangapeka Track (and Leslie/Karamea Track)
Alerts.Detail:
• Western section: Heavy rains have dislodged storm damaged trees on the western section of the Wangapeka Track. This track traverses storm damaged terrain which has some windfallen trees and slips on a sector west of the Belltown Mananui Hut. Users should be fit and experienced to deal with these conditions. Care is required when traversing slip areas.

  • Lower section: Extreme caution required when crossing a large slip located approximately 1 hour 30 minutes walk from Rolling Junction road end. In October 2012 this massive slip created a 15 m high natural dam and a new lake approximately 1 km long and up to a depth of 20 m. When crossing the slip trampers should move quickly, following the marked route and if possible use a spotter to watch for falling rocks. In heavy rainfall, trampers downstream of the dam should move to at least 20 m above the Wangapeka river bed level if they see the water suddenly become discoloured.

Note: These slips also affect the Leslie/Karamea Track as it shares two entry/exit points with the Wangapeka Track.

This is a long term alert.

Alerts.Heading: Butler River (South Branch) and Upper Scone swing bridges destroyed
Alerts.Detail:
The swing bridge across the Butler River (South Branch) has been destroyed. It is possible to cross the river on foot in low flow conditions. Do not attempt to cross if you are inexperienced at river crossings or when the river is high or in flood. The bridge will not be replaced in the near future. 

The Upper Scone swing bridge has also been destroyed. Do not attempt to cross Scone Creek if you are inexperienced at river crossings or when it is high or in flood. No decision has yet been made on bridge replacement.

This is a long term alert.
